items.title: Mohsan is a good voice of TFL
items.review_text: I haven't had the best impression of TFL in the past, I think the reviews below prove my point. However, today I had possibly one of the best Customer Care experiences I have ever had with any company. Mohsan was incredibly helpful, informative and very friendly. He helped me solve my problem with complete professionalism and even gave me some tips on how to avoid my particular issue in the past. Thank you Mohsan, I appreciate you and TFL are lucky to have you.

items.review_text: Yesterday they were protesting and I had to go through London and pay because of diversion, and I forgot to pay so I have to pay 17.50 just now. I hate this charges I hate this government and there rules one day we will fight back for the money you have taking from us all. Fũčķ sunak and khan hope you use all this money to triple on your security

items.title: Can someone please tell me why are we…
items.review_text: Can someone please tell me why are we paying more for a worst service that seems to decline year by year? You shouldn't charge such a high amount when the trains barely works and they now stops once every 20min. What a disappointing service, it has now been going for over a year.

items.title: Money grabbing waste of space
items.review_text: Wastes of space. Took friend to Gatwick airport from midlands, I don't know the area, Google said I wasn't in the zones. Ended up in the zone, didn't get a notification to say I entered the zone and forced to pay a penalty fee for something I wasn't even aware of. Rubbish government scheme as always just there to make money as if the taxes aren't enough already

items.title: Called up, then the CS scumbag refused to assist and laughed then cut the phone off
items.review_text:
I called up requiring assistance (as there's resurfacing works and the bus routes have been messed around with, and as a result i have no idea where to go to get them) 

the staff at the bottom have no information whatsoever, let alone understand (many of which have no understanding of the english language as  has been shown by their inability to care about assisting as is their job

knowing this i require a manager or supervisor as there's near enough no other way to get said information, the scumbag on the phone proceeded to laugh at me then cut the phone off, then repeatedly cutting the phone off when calling back to get said information 

TFL is no longer fit for purpose, whether you want travel information or to get anywhere, PEROID

items.title: The SL7 so called superloop s a joke
items.review_text: The SL7 so called superloop is a joke. How can a bus that is due in 6 minutes disappear from the live timetable and now is another 18 minutes? Totally unreliable

items.title: They don't even deserve 1 star
items.review_text:
They don't even deserve 1 star. I've never seen words, tf and the uk government is happy to take hard working peoples tax, but you as a person do not matter to them. From dlr to jubilee line closures on vital routes for hard working. How do they expect people to travel to work. If all the lines keep getting closed or delayed.

I pray everyone will start driving and boycott and abandon TFL.

items.title: Charged me twice for the same journey…
items.review_text: Charged me twice for the same journey and refused to give me my money back. Tfl needs to get there head out of their ass and realise they are a publicly owned company and actually work for the public instrad of stealing money from people. I will actively encourage people to fare evade from now on

items.title: Without question the worst customer…
items.review_text: Without question the worst customer experience over 2 days I've ever had. The website is totally disjointed. It tells you to make auto top up payments without any link to do so. I phoned customer services who you could barely hear; they would transfer me to departments who had no idea what to do; I have phoned approx 10 times in 2 days. The last person was the most unprofessional customer service adviser ever. They asked me to key payment details into my phone without any assurance about the process, confirmation that I would receive a receipt or anything. Whether I get a replacement card is anyone's guess. not only that, but most of the staff were rude, unprofessional, and sounded thoroughly fed up. If TfL cared they would do something about it, but sadly they don't. Shockingly bad.

items.title: A total disgrace
items.review_text: A total disgrace. Have spent an hour trying to pay ulez and the stupid bot couldn't understand the number plate - 6 times I attempted it. went online and its down for maintenance. A laughing joke of an organisation.  Can't even get the basics right but I'm sure the PCN for non payment will arrive swiftly.

items.title: Could not give video email evidence of…
items.review_text:
Could not give video email evidence of accused of being stopped in a yellow boxed junction. Name was written wrong on all letters and after had told them many times.
Only way to appeal is speaking to lawyers or taking time off work and travelling into central London to see their office (I'm self employed).
Money making scheme targeting car drivers to subsidise TFL workers wages and pay rises and subsidise non paying Transport customers.

items.title: To pay or not to pay?
items.review_text:
Is it just me or is the TfL website the most unprofessional and confusing website?

I have an electric car and one page tells me I have to pay congestion charge whilst another clearly says that my car is exempt.

items.title: Would give TFL 0 stars if I could
items.review_text: TFL are rotten to the core. Their ethos is to fleece decent hard working people of money by making it almost impossible to deal with them - and what sort of organisation puts ULEZ cameras at the Royal Marsden to fleece visitors who are out of the area of £90? Disgusting behaviour. They deliberately lie in their responses to FoIs, even to MPs, and evade answering the real questions relating to ULEZ (e.g. total cost of repair to damaged cameras) by giving totally misleading and dishonest answers (when they feel like responding and aren’t hiding behind the ICO). A wholesale change in management is need to change this so there’s transparency about where all the money goes that has been misspent. Hopefully when Khan gets the boot the new mayor will make TfLs mismanagement public knowledge and root out the rottenness pervading TFL.

items.title: At last the 110 bus is back to normal
items.review_text: At last the 110 bus is travelling in both directions on Sandycombe road. It has been awful for people like me who rely on the bus to get to Richmond to have to walk to the no. 65. I have mechanical knees. Another lady I know is on chemo and for her it has been a nightmare. I was so thrilled to at last see the 110 travel in both directions

items.title: tfl is a waste of time
items.review_text: tfl is a waste of time, trying to login to cancel autopay & literally have no way to reset password, this is a joke

items.title: Unreliable information

The services for a certain line is not accurate at all. No train to the destination, but they show up in the website as a good service. 
Unreliable at all!!!!

items.title: Worst transport ever
items.review_text: Worst transport ever. The london public transport is the worst 92 especially which regularly late 30 mins sometimes in the morning. I was late from my job multiple times because the 92 didn't come in time sometimes I have waited 30 mins for the bus but ofc they make you pay for the journey... they keep striking for pay rise but most of those drivers deserve nothing,the way they treat with people is nonsense most of them are very arrogant and pompous! They should get trained how to treat with people!!!! Tfl should monitor them regularly and punish them if needed. I would give 0 rate if I could!!!!

items.review_text:
Scum
Bags and dangerous. They allow people to steal and go behind and not pay they can be terorist with weapons I complained and they said call and email and send the compalint and charged me 9 pounds when someone else stole the train fare. items.title: Shambolic service
items.review_text:
Just like the over reviews, we are sick of this shambolic service! They increase the fairs but can't get a single train on time, everyday delays while they use made up excuses "delays due to the lack of trains". 

Train drivers make 63k+ a year while also extra benefits such as a lot of holiday, free transportation yet they still complain! Try being on minimum wage! 

Just make the trains run automatically without them then! We pay enough for them to actually make the service better. 

When will someone in parliament do something about this? Whats happening to this country! Bunch of lazy and no for good people.

items.title: England v Brazil
items.review_text:
Hi.

I am not a commuter however recently went to England V Brazil at Wembley. Everyone is far too quick to complain but I’d just like to state that TFL (& Met police) nailed it. Leaving Wembley with an 8yo was a little nervy but all authorities were fantastic and TFL was amazing. Home within 1hr 20 to Bedford. Shake my son’s 1st experience of an international was marred by drugged up, pissd up racist ‘fans’ directly in the front of us. We were  H BLOCK 140, ROW 9, SEAT 203 & 204. 
As I said, it was an International Friendly: England v Brazil Saturday, 23 March 2024 19:00. NOT A SINGLE FAULT OF THE RESELLER, THL or external services but marred the night, especially when the internal Wembley services admitted they knew of him and had issues in the past

items.title: TFL has the worst customer service
items.review_text: TFL has the worst customer service. There is no protection in their systems for people against fraud. The staff on the phone will refuse to listen to anything, despite being confronted with visual facts. It's scary, saddening, and frightening that such a large organization can be so badly managed. There is no escalation process and you can not speak to anyone with any authority. They need to be scrapped and started again by someone with a brain

items.title: There is no 0 stars to give as I would
items.review_text: There is no 0 stars to give as I would. If should write here all about tfl I would need days. So I ll make short, most unsafe with most unprepared staff , most expensive just to make you be late, and out of 10 countries I ve seen in EU, London has the worse public transport services. Whenever delays happen they won t let you know at the entrance, would charge you money just for going in and out of the station, and guess what, no point to call to get your money back, cause your call would cost more than the travel itself. All they are the best at though, is cancelling services for maintenance still to have the worst services, and strikes. They re really good at that

items.title: I am giving a 1 because I can't give a…
items.review_text:
I am giving a 1 because I can't give a 0. TFL is a an absolute joke. 
They have the highest prices of transport and thier services are amazingly awful compare to other countries, specifically their costumer service. 
Buses in the middle of winter blowing cold air, taking weeks to anwer complaints, refunding the wrong amount. And of course strike all the time.

items.title: TFL worst ever service & total criminals
items.review_text: I would like to give 0 stars but that's not an option. TFL is 1 of the worst companies, all they want to do is charge ridiculous high prices to travel just making them even richer, whilst robbing their customers who have no choice but to use the services. I was using an oyster card to travel and unfortunately it stopped working, I called for either a refund of my money or transfer the funds onto a new card, now this supposedly can't be done without registering for an account. Why does everyone want you to register your information, its my information & I don't want to register, it should be simple to refund my money, not with these criminals as they have now stolen my money are TFL not rich enough that they have to resort to robbing people

items.title: You absolute scum bags
items.review_text:
You absolute scum bags. You’ve ripped me off 3 times with the driving in London tickets. Each time I have entered my postcode and reg plate on your app and it’s showed me what ticket to purchase to be ok to drive in London. 

Each time I drove there I ended up with a £270 parking ticket!!! We are filling your pockets with our hard earned cash, while you all party, eating pheasant and sniffing coke! 

I hope each and every single one of you involved in TfL including the mayor, to have a miserable life.

items.title: London transport is 100 % worst !To…
items.review_text: London transport is 100 % worst !To travel to work or to come back home I lose 2 hours on the way to go and 2 hours to return home. The Central Line not working properly until July, so how do I go to work?? Need to find different ways because always something cancel .Everyday!!! We travel huddled together like animals but paying 10 pounds to go and come back from work.Most expensive and worst.Shame of you!! Is it London or the 3rd world?

items.title: Got an over 60 Oyster card London free…
items.review_text: Got an over 60 Oyster card London free travel with date of January 2030 for a £20.00 fee, however my card got cancelled because it was not renewed for a fee of £10.00 which was referred by Email, never saw the email and missed it, contacted TFL but was advised to make a new application and £20.00 again, I was new to this Oyster over 60 and nothing is mentioned on the back of the card to renew and why put a 10 year exp date if its no longer valid after a year because you didnt renew and pay a £10 fee, no other form of communication from TFL either by text of letter, end of, very disappointing, the card is misleading by putting and exp date which is no longer valid if you dont pay your yearly fee, bad review for TFL.

items.title: Most unreliable public transport ever
items.review_text:
Most unreliable public transport ever. Especially London buses and especially bus route 1. For the past 3 months since I started taking the bus from King's Cross to Surrey Quays, the bus always terminates early at Elephant and Castle. I can basically count the number of times where the bus actually reach it's original destination on one hand.

Absolutely fuc***ING awful.

items.title: Absolute shambolic service
items.review_text: Absolute shambolic service, they increase the train fares and can't get a single train on time; every single day trains are delayed. These train drivers are earning £65k a year and have the audacity to strike. Sick and tired of this nonsense. Fix up TFL and do better, a system full of corruption.

items.title: QUESTIONABLE DRIVER WARNING
items.review_text: I have neutral experiences with TFL. This 1 (would make it 0 if I can) star is for that questionable R4 bus driver last 13 May 2023 (1738h) in PRUH who acted like he was either a racist, having personal issues he bought to work, or was just simply an as***** who somehow managed to get through screening. Good luck with your safety if you come across him. Didn't know they would employ hostile/verbally aggressive driver's who seem like they want to kill you for just standing there.

items.title: Constant cancelled trains
items.review_text: The 7:00 am train from St Margarets to Waterloo gets cancelled every other day, only 2 to 3 minutes before it is due, so you have paid your ticket, and the reason is: overrunning ingeneering works. They didn't finish on time! Every week, at least 2 days or 3, this happens. They really don't care.

items.title: Don't really understand why I have to…
items.review_text: Don't really understand why I have to give one star to continue. This company is 0 stars for me.TFL mainly the western section of Elizabeth Line after Paddington is pure hell to use. Every day some problems. Few days before broken rail,broken points, signal failure in both directions and broken train's door at Paddington..this evening the train is going 5mph because of a problem under investigation..hell.  close it and bring GWR Trains back. You just wasted billions of pounds on Elizabeth line to make the actual services worse than it was before. Well done. Hope you'll burn in hell one day for this..

I support the rights of workers but I would have so much more support for the regular TFL disruptions if they took a little more care in their hiring policy.

items.review_text: Very complicated and ended up paying fine of 180 pounds although I had paid ULEZ online. Contacted the agents and every agent telling me to do different thing and tired of following their wrong guidance and ended up paying £180 at the end. The PNC kept building up although it was in process of investigation. I was away on operational tour for 6 months and I sent them the proof of the payment of the ULEZ charge.

items.title: I can’t stand TFL
items.review_text: I can’t stand TFL. Not just there excessive prices but there rude workers. Today I was at my local bus stop coming home from taking your trains when the bus arrived and completely skipped this woman in a wheel chair with clear space in disabled area and acknowledging her. She had been there before me so imagine how many times that may of happened to this poor woman. Yet again another bus driver does it again with complete acknowledgement of her, one of the people at the bus stop had to remind him to let the woman on with complete ignorance he ignored till he continuously banged on the window to let the women in the wheel chair on and even ran after the bus to do so, it outrageous that the gentlemen had to go to this  extent of banging on the window and shouting to be able to let this wheelchair on. This is one of many stupid TFL worker I have to deal with daily your behaviour is disgusting. Where do you hire such people?

items.title: Contactless does NOT mean contactless cards
items.review_text:
I am not from London and apart from my recent visit, not been for a number of years.
Went to see ABBA Voyager. My planned train station was closed due to electrical problems. I was unsure of alternative route, so went to ticket office for their advice & bought ticket using contactless credit card.
Found out the next day that TfL advertising "Contactless" does NOT include contactless card when buying a ticket. It only means touch in/touch out at stations.

I complained to TfL but was told "contactless does NOT mean buying a ticket using contactless credit card and therefore I was correctly charged cash price"

items.title: TFL for london transport
items.review_text: this company will never do anything to help the working person, corrupt to the core, Money grabbing lying scum, continue to bleed people dry, This is a 0 in my book, worse mayor ever, So got a rod stuck up his derriere ,

items.title: Closed my online auto pay account early…
items.review_text:

Paid ULEZ online today, no email received. Money not gone from my account but cant pay again as it says I have already paid online.
This must be the most inefficient online 'service' I have ever used.
Absolutely shocking.

items.title: Only giving one star cause we can’t…
items.review_text: Only giving one star cause we can’t give zero! Been living in London for almost 5 years and compared to many countries the transport system is a joke! Extremely expensive while trains are old, broken, every single week you’ll face delays, cancelling, the best is the customer service since staff is pretty much useless (barely existent) and when you can find one they’ll look like u are disturbing them and you’ll tell you to “check the board cause we don’t know”. Hopefully we’ll go full automatic in the future and have no drivers since most of them are on £40,000 a year (more than double than most people that PAY TfL everyday) and still striking 6 months into the year, entitled to say the least, let’s see how they’ll feel when their jobs are GONE!

items.title: Unprofessional London Underground staff
items.review_text:
On the 9th of July 2023 at 4pm I was travelling on the Piccadilly line from Earls Court where there were a group of 6 youths who were smoking cannabis in the carriage. A gentleman asked them to stop in which he was insulted and told to mind his own business.
He then stopped the train at South Kensington and asked the staff to remove them from the train but was simply told that he was holding up the train. As a result he came off train in disgust. I AM EXTREMELY ANGRY WITH THE SLACK DISGUSTING ATTITUDE OF THE LONDON UNDERGROUND STAFF. YOU RAISE THE PRICES YET PROVIDE A POOR SERVICE. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE AND THERE WILL BE CONSEQUENCES WHEN PEOPLE WILL TAKE MATTERS INTO THEIR OWN HANDS.

items.title: TFL and its bosses are what modern…

items.title: disaster
items.review_text:
Hello.

items.title: Why do tfl ignore the government car…
items.review_text: Why do tfl ignore the government car checker linked to CAZ areas? They force use of their own checker, which can inaccurately state your car as being liable for the ULEZ charge. The government checker is directly linked to the DVLA, so is correct in its information. Could it be that tfl need the money, so are making avoidance of the charge as difficult as possible? My car is exempt for Bristol which means it is Euro 6 compliant - it is apparently an 'early adopter' of the required standard. Before becoming aware of this, I paid the charge on 3 different occasions because I can't even go to the Wandsworth recycling centre without entering the zone! I cannot be exempted by tfl without sending them a copy of my V5, so have had to apply to the DVLA for an updated document. The whole situation is ridiculous and legalised theft.

items.title: London Congestion charge scam!
items.review_text:
As a part of my work I was forced to travel into central London on Thursday October 5th. I saw many signs advising that I may be charged for the privilige of joining the congestion. What I did not see was:
How to pay.
What to pay.
Where to pay.
When to pay.
Whether my vihicle was exempt.
I eventually found some answers on the TFL web site but I could not sign into my account as I do not have one. I did not want to set up an account as I have no intention of driving in London again.
By the time I had exhausted all the completely irrelevant links I tried calling the phone number but the line was closed by then.
A few days later I called again and was directed to the Artificial Idiot who asked many questions but was unable to directly answer my questions. I was then directed to a real person who was only able to tell me I was too late to pay!

items.title: Negative customer services
items.review_text:
I applied for a 18year old oyster card for my son, it was rejected as he is still in college and turned 18 after 31 August.
I paid £20 for the application  which nonrefundable according to TFL.
Therefore he is still entitled to the 16 plus oyster card,  which tfl agreed. 

We tried to apply for the 16± oyster, this did not work once we put in the date of birth.
We told there was a technical fault,  as usual. 
After several weeks of several phones made to TFL, we were told we will receive paperwork via post which we took to the post office for verification,  we also affixed a photo as requested. 
I paid another £20 for this application and also paid £8 for next day delivery. 

After waiting for almost a week,  we rang TFL 

1. TfL state they received the application but did not update the system because they lost my child's photo, which was securely and properly affixed. 

2. Secondly, TfL then state they now have a technical fault and i need repeat the process,  meaning I have got to wait for paperwork to come through the post once again - another 10days.
Affix another picture then pay £20 again!!

This is NOT Acceptable!!!

Customer services are not helpful at all.

I have asked to speak to management to no avail. 
This is very frustrating!
Therefore I got my son the usual/normal oyster while henis a student, still in sixth-form.

items.title: Incompetent and Extremely poor service

The next lady very rudely informed that we will not get a refund and they will issue the new card and put the monthly travel card back on the oyster. This was in contradiction to what I was previously informed. She refused to put me through to a manager and kept on insisting that it was my sons fault that he lost the card. After 7 days the card arrived and it had no monthly pass transferred and after another 2 days the credit of wrong amount came in. Now I have to spend an hour to sort this out. Extremely rude, incompetent and least bothered attitude.

items.title: Winner of the worst website for account registration
items.review_text:
This is a review of the website (ULEZ in this case, but it applies to any TfL account) which appears to have been written by a trainee programmer on his first assignment.
Upon registration, you are assigned a random (and long) Account Number. This is displayed on the screen and is never sent in any confirmation / activation email.
The real cost of this becomes apparent when you attempt to login subsequently and cannot remember this long account number. You remember your password, your memorable date, everything. Just not the ridiculous random account number. And there is no way to retrieve this; the Forgot My Password  button helpfully demands your Account Number (recall, they made no effort to share this with you upon registration). 
You now also cannot set up another account.
Great work guys.

EDIT: An hour and a half later, I received an email with an attached letter which did have my account number. I added a star for that, but there's huge room for improvement. Please at least fix all the broken links

I struggled to make payment for congestion after trying multiple times etc I managed to pay the following day. Still stating I pay £15. It was not made clear that the charge went up to £17.50 as it was outside of 24hrs time frame even though I put my registration number in. You’d like to think in a day and age where everything is online and machine oriented it would have calculated that in-fact  the due payment would have been £17.50. But NO! I then have a letter through to say I need to now pay £90. So I called up and actually spoke to someone (of course they can speak to you when taking money for a fine) and they explained and was very helpful I have to say. However. They explained to me that I have to pay the £90 and I can’t just pay the £2.50 extra. And on top you don’t get your £15 back which you innocently paid. Honestly talk about thieving. Feel a bit mugged off paying £105 to drive through a patch of tarmac in London.

items.title: Awful website, staff talk to you like you are an idiot
items.review_text:
Trying to renew my blue badge discount for Transport for London.  Blue badge renewals have a backlog so my discount expired as they needed my new badge before I could renew.

I have two letters from Transport for London telling me how easy it is to renew and that I can renew upto 90 days after expiry without paying the £10 fee.

I follow the link to the website and there is an option to "Apply or renew", click this link and there is no option to renew, just apply for £10.

Try phoning the number on the website and it just gives you options about speaking to them about Oyster card.

Phone the number on the letter and get told my discount has expired and I should renew before it expires.  Explain I can't do that because blue badge has taken until now to arrive.

So I'm told I just need to click the apply button which says it will cost £10 but this won't charge me £10 because I'm renewing within 90 days.

Told him it would be useful if it gave this information on the site, rather than making it look like you'd be charged £10.  So he told me I need to enter my account number and blue badge number to apply.  Told him again, yes I'm not an idiot I know how to apply, but I'm telling you that you should have something on the site saying it won't charge £10.  again, he told me that because I'm applying within 90 to renew I won't be charged.  Again told him I understand that but they should have something online that says that.

A simple thing that should have taken me about 1 minute to renew has taken over an hour because of a bad website, no relevant options on the phone number given and useless staff who just read from a script rather than using common sense and actually listening to what you are saying.

items.title: Calmed me down after a panic attack and helped me find a place to stay
items.review_text: I’m writing to sing my praises for the wonderful staff at Edgeware Road Station (bakerloo line). On Sunday 9th July I got stranded in london after I missed the last train to Cambridge after the BST Hyde Park event. As a result I ended up having a panic attack and was extremely distressed as I was a woman all alone and wasn’t sure what to do. The lovely staff at Edgware station took me into their office, gave me water, calmed me down and reassured me that I was safe, and then kindly arranged for me to stay in a hostel next door. They then looked up the earliest trains I could catch for King’s Cross the next morning, and spoke to my friend on the phone to explain the situation. They even called to check in on me the next morning. I’m forever grateful for the kindness they showed me and I really really hope they all get a raise!

items.title: Track-Noise on London Underground
items.review_text:
TfL must warn its passengers to protect the hearing of Babies, Children, Pets and Service Dogs from the Track-Noise on the London Underground.

The screeching track-noise on journeys remains unbearably loud for passengers on the Victoria, Central and Northern Lines.

Its been worsening each year and TfL’s noise reduction initiatives have seemingly failed to address the problem in all this time.

NHS Audiologists have raised concerns on BBC News back in 2019, and citizens have filed formal complaints to no avail, recently my iphone recorded 103 decibels on the Victoria Line.

Ear-defenders cannot even block out the high-pitch screeching track noise from my experience, which evidently highlights the severity of the issue.  

You can find my petition on the Change website by searching:

TfL should warn its passengers to protect hearing from Track-Noise on London Underground.

items.title: Do not order oyster card on the TFL app
items.review_text:
Do not order oyster card on the TFL app, save yourself a time and just buy it from the shop.

I have lost my oyster card, I thought I'm busy and I could not go and buy one from the shop so I'll order one from the TFL app, so it will save time for me. 

Now it has been almost 2 weeks. I have been charged for the oyster £7 and did not receive the oyster as says 5-7 working days. 

Tried to contact customer service, so the call was no success waiting for a long time on the line, no one answered, there was an option to choose so TFL will call back and no need to wait on the line till someone answers, so I choosed that. After some time, I got a call back saying they calling from TFL, I checked the number on who called me uk and guess what it is a scam number so I'm not continuing conversation on the phone with them. Also intresting how they know I called TFL.

I'm thinking what else I can do.

I thought I just go to the station and ask the people who work there to check where is it, and when I receive it, and what is happening as it been almost 2 weeks since I order it and I need to go to work and I need oyster for that. And guess what, again, it was a waste of my time no one, and the information or ticket office was able to help me. Actually it seemed they have no intrest to look into my matter.

I feel robbed and scamed. It doesn't matter it is only £7 but wait, how much will I get charged for an unsuccessful call to TFL?  It is a steeling!

Every year, I pay more for travel, almost every month some strike, cancellations of the journeys and I have to be ok to pay hundreds of pounds every month for travel. But then there is no way to get in contact with TFL when there are these sorts of issues for the people who travel.

App is useless. There is no way to sort this issue yourself, I try to write this enquiry on the app under all possible options, and it is not submitting my request. Plus, if you forgot your memorable information on the account, there are no options to change it. Even consider that you have to use the verification number to log in to your account. 

I feel disappointed, I have used oyster for more than 10 years, but the TFL customer service should be improved as it has gone to zero, seems no one can sort your issue neither ticket office, neither information desk.

items.title: I had to put one star but really I’m…
items.review_text: I had to put one star but really I’m fuming. I’ve received a £270 fine for not paying the congestion charge on the 7th of February (as if I remember what I was doing 5 months ago). The thing is I’ve never received the PCN for the initial £90 fine. Then I received another 2 for paying the wrong dates… so far in 2023 I’ve got £450 to pay in fines, for 3 honest mistakes, and we’re not even half-way through the year. I’ve tried to register for automatic payment but there was a bug so I guess it didn’t work. I’ve told them I don’t have the means to pay such a humongous sum of money but the “Contracts & Operations Manager” wrote me back saying (in substance) that they don’t give a s**t. The simplest mistake will be met by, not a slap on the wrist, but a punch in the face. This is how TFL treat people. And the worst part is that if more than 2 people are travelling it’s cheaper to drive than to take public transport… so I guess the congestion charge will go up soon. Disgusting company.

I registered my card online to claim a refund this took an hour to set up as I was repeatedly asked to confirm I was a human before the page crashed…….three times. As a technophobic 73 yr old I am now very reluctant to travel into London again and I found the whole saga distressing. If I could have given customer services zero stars I would have done. items.title: TFL A British embarrassment!
items.review_text:
I drove into central London on two occasions, paid both congestion and ULEZ charges. Now I have a fine through the post of £90. Upon discussing this with 4 people from TFL, it seems on one day, I paid for the wrong day, one day ahead. 

Now I'm hit with an extortionate £90 fine and I cannot get the day I paid for refunded. So they take my money when I dont go into london, bypass my honest mistake and fine me anyway.

They say on the phone that they provide a friendly, helpful service and won't tollorate any abuse. I personally can't think of anything els they deserve more.

London it seems is designed to strip you of any money. What an embarrassment to the British public.

Ways to improve? Actually use the rip off fines to pay for better car parking, cctv, bus and rail services as they're all lacking.

Disgusting how they can get away with that and taking so much off local car drivers.

items.title: TfL EVERYDAY
items.review_text:
Train delays, train faulties, light faulties, train cancellations not to mention constant strikes affecting everyday people lives who wants to live, get to and from work. 
Tourists who, if they don't speak much of an english or are in London for the first time, trying to travel around London can get a lot of headache if this will affect them, and it is already affecting them already too!
This is the reality of Transport for London and the way they treat all of us. Everything being covered with selling us stories about how awesome the new trains are or how beatiful the station look... well, that is not improving the services at all! 
For years I was so impressed with the way how TFL operates around such a huge city, but since last year it is an absolute disaster! And what we get back? Price increase for the tickets. WOW! For what? What are we paying for when we receive absolutely nothing back? Lack of respect to all of the Londoners on so many levels.

items.title: Abusive customer service
items.review_text:
1) On the 12th of December, because of TFL disruptions due to weather, my journey was significantly disrupted. I arrived to destination with more than an hour delay, and I paid more money for a longer journey

2) On the 13th of December, due to a strike, I had to complete once again a longer and more expensive journey

3) On the 16th of December, I called customer service. I had to call three times, and each time the call was abruptly ended after a very long wait and while I was speaking with an adviser, for reasons that are unknown to me. I suppose it was due to technical problems, but I would expect them to call me back, since they had my number

4) During the third phone call, the customer advisor confirmed a refund. She put me on hold to get a reference number to give to me to confirm refund, but while I was on hold the telephone call ended once again

5) It took me more than an hour to make all these phone calls, and this caused me further significant disruption

6) Therefore, I wrote a formal complaint, covering all the points above

7) The person getting back to me, Claire F - Customer Service Adviser - gave me conflicting information compared to a) the previous phone call and b) previous similar cases in which I was provided with a refund for similar reasons. She said that I was not entitled to a refund, as I managed to complete the journey. Hence without taking into account:

- The delays due to longer journeys
- The difference in money due to longer journeys
- The disruptions caused by the poor phone call customer service

8) I therefore replied and asked to escalate the complaint. Accordingly to TFL policy and guidelines: ""We try to resolve your complaint the first time you contact us. If you are not satisfied with our response, tell us and we will ask a team manager to review it."

9) However, the policy and guidelines were not followed, and another Customer Service Adviser - Clare S - got back to me

10) Despite me asking to escalate the complaint, this was not done and I was only given a generic link to the TFL website, which I believe is once again very poor customer service and a clear way to brush off my case

11) I wrote another complaint, and Halimat M (again, not a team leader) got back to me, with an exact copy-and-paste from previous replies, not addressing the many points raised in my complaint and not tailoring the response to my individual needs, making me feel completely devalued and disrespected

I am now planning to go through Ombudsman and ask even more than the refund, for all the time this is taking.

Horrible, appalling, abusive customer service.

items.title: Money-making fines
items.review_text:
Money-making fines
I wish I had sufficient space to tell everyone about the unjust fines applied to motorists under the pretext of ULEZ.
The whole country has not been informed about the London zone increases, but TFL consider it a practical suggestion that before making a journey away from your home YOU must read your Highway Code to familiarise yourself with the new regulations. 
Even though they have not been publicised in your area at all.
 And then if make the mistake of unwittingly breaching the regulations on more than one occasion they will treat every occasion as an opportunity to repeat the fine.
 And then if you are away from home for 4 weeks  and unaware of the offence they will treble the four fines if you are not there to answer for your error in the first 14 days.
Sadly TfL is this government’s body and as such has similar disregard as the government for the North of England. 
Amazingly they are punishing us for owning a car that was billed as eco friendly when we bought it !

items.title: If I could give them zero stars I…
items.review_text: If I could give them zero stars I would, their 313 bus service is so beyond a joke that it is borderline torture. Doesn’t matter how many times you complain about it’s lack of service and disorganisation, the fact it’s the only bus that serves a specific and quite rural area and the fat they can run anywhere between 30 mins to 1 he 45 apart which has happened to me many times, the fact the drivers don’t stop, the fact they are all request stops so the drivers act like you didn’t flag them down and then have to wait a stupid amount of time for the next one that don’t let you on coz it’s full so you have to wait for the next one. It adds on average another 2.5 hours or more onto my Appel day just travelling home. It is so disgraceful I have had to complain about it multiple times before they even made it a double decker route! It passes three schools just in the portion I have to travel which is only Enfield to potter bar , Some mornings I couldn’t get to work because of it!

items.title: Irresponsible
items.review_text:
I have recieved a penalty notice for an offence which occurred on the 27/11/2022 ticke issued on the 30/11/2020 but the first notice arrived on 03/01/2023 so technically I have missed the opportunity to pay half of the penalty which is £80. I have called Tfl customer service number spoke to three advisers they told me to pay the full amount as the issue is with royal male nothing to do with Tfl. I have called royal mail customer service number they explained about back log and strikes. I have requested to speak to a manager in Tfl to explain the issue he told me I can appeal it but told me I need to pay the full amount as the appeal won't make any changes.

 How would I know if I don't receive a notice letter on time. It is totally devastating and depressing experience I feel I have robbed my chance to pay the half price because thier third part royal mail couldn't mail the notice on time. Such opportunists.

Other line which meant to be at 6:27am didn't come at all, next one 6:38am same. No information on TFL website about any disruptions on these routes. Terrible,ignorant service,not the first time. Looks like drivers choosing their own routes.

items.review_text: The Live bus arrivals service which gives on line information of when buses arrive at a particular stop has become useless. Buses no longer arrive at the specified time and are often 10-15 minutes late. Abysmal service.

items.title: Ulez Expansion Tax
items.review_text:
i'll keep this short, speaking on behalf of many small businesses depending on delivering throughout London, this planned London wide ULEZ expansion is a rip off. The whole clean air aspect is nothing but a cash cow and will have a Hugh impact on residents & small business alike. How on earth is a business operating 3 vans or less going to afford to replace there vehicles with a newer fleet in this fragile present economy. And even if you wanted to there is no availability for upto a year from the manufacturers.  How can similar businesses absorb this additional monthly cost of £1,125. Sadiq Khans ambition of breathing allegedly clean air  will be to the detriment of 10's of thousands of Londoners and is only another tax burden on the hard working back boners.
My mobile advertising boards are available for similarly disgruntled business operaters out there who would like to share there frustrations with the public

items.title: The biggest pile of faeses Ever

The biggest pile of faeces Ever, when asked about getting from A 2 B they show you the routes using the underground or overground trains which of course they are 3 time more expensive than the bus,
Wanted to go from cronwel Road to elephant and castle, my option was to chose Earl's Court Station, I had to search how to do that through Google and of course it showed me that the bus 360 follows the route I needed, I assume we are paying extra on transportation because the decided to waste 10 of K in an app that is not worth using, unless you are looking for underground route,I can't tell you how USELESS that is as I uninstall the app after failing to find what I was looking for.
MENTALLY HILLARIOUS

items.title: Arriva Bus Garage Tottenham
items.review_text:
Arriva Bus Garage Tottenham, London 
Left a very expensive brolly on the 19 bus yesterday (20/12/22) and from the first call when the lady in lost property called the driver to the men who work in the depot tonight and drivers, I was treated so well. Way above and beyond in customer service. 
I was escorted from the entrance to the office where I collected it and then one of the staff bought me a coffee as I had a long journey home. Absolute gentleman. And he found out my bus to get home. 
Arjay (spelling ?) was terrific in giving me instruction to get there on the phone and had it ready for me. 
They make TFL proud and no way you would expect this care 
So grateful

I assume that the multi millionaire mayor of of London or TFL will be putting their hands in their "tax payers" pockets (including mine and ive paid enough for 44 years and still paying) to give me the money to pay for another car. I also assume they will also give me a list of cars that I can buy.

items.title: Saturday 12 November at 18.00 from last…
items.review_text: Saturday 12 November at 18.00 from last stop of bus number 158 .the bus driver name was Charlene we had the same bus 🚌 1 hour earlier from Black Horse road underground to Old Road the last bus stop of 158 as I haven't used Victoria line since over 20 years ago when I moved from North to South and I was very surprised there wasn't any lift for my elderly nun 94 years old she should climb all stairs Charlene has provided me with An amazing service to advise me to check even to call stations for me to find out which station has a lift for my nun.Our experience was out standing and we had great advises and conversation even on our way back as I was afraid to go to Tottenham Hale as i felt safer to stay and be guided by Charlene .The lady deserve recognition and please I would love to hear how she will be rewarded for the great support and advices she has provided for the travel arrangements of my 94 years old grandmother.Many thanks Eva

items.title: Heathrow shuttle
items.review_text: I used the Heathrow shuttle between T2/3 and T4 last month, tapped my Oyster card on entry and exit for what should have been a free ride, but found recently on checking my account they had charged £11.50. Apparently it is now too late to obtain a refund. A couple of weeks later I had to wait around an hour for the same service. Lucky I didn't have a flight to catch.

items.title: TFHELL
items.review_text:
The rail network in London is absolutely pathetic and disastrous! 
Whenever there are ‘extreme’ weather conditions, trains are being delayed and cancelled! The infrastructure of this city is just ridiculous, they are never prepared for anything! When is heavy raining, trains stop; when is too hot outside, trains stop; when is snowing, trains stop! There are thousands of people depending on this travelling network and yet they are taking the p**s every time they get the chance!
So many strikes this past year, not being ‘satisfied’ with their salaries, however they are getting paid a whole load of money! Now I’m asking you, do you deserve your salaries when everything you do is letting people down every time? 
Those union bosses of yours should take into consideration the people that are relying on train services as well!
Shame on you! Shame on you!!!

items.title: Do not use OysterCard if not from UK
items.review_text: The service itself is top-notch, I am from the US and I don't know any train service (except maybe NYC) where trains come every 2-3 mins apart. No complaints there and is reflected in the rating. However, I think you should stop advertising OysterCard to non-UK travelers and encourage them to use their contactless credit cards instead. I used Oyster on my last trip and since I am unable to create an Oyster account (needs UK address and phone number) I cannot get my ride history. I requested it from TFL customer service and even got back a token and promise of 10 day turnaround but its now close on 45 days and I haven't heard back. If you need to do an expense report, much more advisable to use a regular touch-less US credit card -- its as convenient and not much different expense-wise.

items.title: Robbing working class people
items.review_text:
Very expensive tickets, totally unreliable service, staff always on strike. Taking their monopoly to next level by restricting usage of cars by charging crazy amount of money for congestion charge, ULEZ charge, vague traffic rules to find opportunity to penalize normal people. Basically all nightmare created to rob common working class people. Rich don't care and criminals/thieves/beggars never have to pay. 

Car prices have sky rocketed due to stupid ULEZ rules and car ownership is not affordable. Have to use car hire when needed instead of relying on public transport

This year, suffered 3 major tube strikes and car hire prices sky rocketed, impacting my critical work.

Got penalty for passing hidden school zone area in a hired car for first visit to my kid's school. I was new to such traffic rules and country. The sign was like an essay and by the time I finish reading, I was captured on camera. 200 GBP fine gone from middle class person for small mistake.

H28 bus comes once is 2-3 hours frequently and can terminate randomly in the mid-way. Regularly walked couple of miles with my kid to reach his tuition classes in hot summer. Already complained.

Today Overground is not working and my family is stuck away from home and trying to find alternate route.

items.title: Honestly there should be a -1 star
items.review_text:
Honestly there should be a -1 star. 

My issue was I tapped in using my credit card at Heathrow where it should be free. Apparently they charged me the maximum fee 10.80£ or something and the worst thing was that cards balance is always 0 cause I don’t use it much. So it went into overdraft for a while without me realising it and got an extra bill at the end from the bank.

I tried registering an account to get the refund, didn’t work, kept getting an error which doesn’t even tell you what you did wrong. By the way the register form is the worst form I have come across since internet was invented.

I emailed them, they take 2 weeks to reply and when they do they just tell you try registering again or we are looking into your issue. I emailed them close to 10 times until I got tired. I wish their whole database and server could go offline for at least a week and the hacker demands for them to improve their services and pay back all the money they stole from customers who can’t get their refunds cause they are running a scam at this point. Stealing from unknowing customers.
Another option will be a having a huge sign at the tube in Heathrow that says “WE HAVE A HORRIBLE WEBSITE SO DON’T EXPECT REFUNDS IF YOU ACCIDENTALLY TAP WITH CREDIT CARD!”

Word of advice, never tap in or out with a credit card that doesn’t have a contactless limit, or else you will find yourself in my shoes.

If tfl ever reads this, just know that am not the only unhappy customer and if you don’t reform your services, one day it will all come crashing down on you.

items.title: We last visited London 2 years ago and…
items.review_text: We last visited London 2 years ago and saved our Oyster cards which we had to keep as they no longer have refunds for them, we then took them to London again last week to use them only to find they had been blocked from being useable and we could no longer return them for our original deposit either so had to buy another two Oyster cards, we tried calling the number on them as we were told and could not even get through to a human to unblock them, absolutely useless service and pointless system for those who are only visiting London for a short period.

items.title: MISSED DENTAL APPOINTMENT
items.review_text: Oh dear what a disaster. I was due to attend a 1.30pm appointment Thursday 13 October at the dental clinic in Guy’s Hospital. This required a tube journey to London Bridge and my first time accessing the tube as a wheelchair user. When using the journey planner I could not grasp, to be what I consider a very confusing set of symbols supposedly designed to make your journey by wheelchair as smooth as possible. On entering my trip details in I’m provided with a very simple 34 minute ride using Hammersmith and City Line then transferring to the Jubilee line at Baker Street. By bus it’s a 4 bus journey taking 1hour 10 minutes. This is where I made one of two mistakes. I was always journey planning as a mobile user not in need of step free wheelchair accessibility. The first box you see under cycling and other options includes a full step free access symbol which completely went over my head. The next boxes were the tube journey offered, impossible in the wheelchair then the 4 bus trip which was impractical. I began a Google search on how to access the Jubilee line by lift but was finding this difficult. I downloaded a pdf Avoiding Stairs Tube Guide. This was a jumble of confusing symbols. My second mistake was not going by taxi but I wasn’t sure I was mobile or strong enough to enter and exit the cab. Finally the day before travel and exhausting all attempts to find a solution I called TFL. The advisor gave me instructions to enter at Paddington Elizabeth line and take the tunnel to connect via lift to the Bakerloo line, exiting at Waterloo then using the lift to join the Jubilee line. Arriving at Waterloo the gap was too wide to allow the wheelchair off so we traveled the two stops to Elephant and Castle. A supervisor attempted to get Waterloo to have someone on the platform to provide assistance but they didn’t appear to be cooperative. Finally just before our tube departed the supervisor advised that there wasn’t lift access to the Jubilee line at Waterloo. The only solution was to return to Paddington, missing my dental hospital appointment. In order to find out and to see what another advisor would suggest I just called the TFL number. It’s not a pleasant experience. Not only do they suggest that you avoid using public transport, rather walk or cycle to free up the space for those who really need it but you should only press star to speak to someone if you are disabled otherwise use the automated service. We have an NHS service that we are supposed to protect by not using it and a public transport system we shouldn’t use either. This is really clown town London 2022. Kevin the advisor I just spoke to (Friday 14 October) was polite but seemed to be finishing a meal or taking dishes to the sink. When I asked if he would kindly enter my journey to see what his best option would be he said NO and apologised as the system was down. It isn’t down on my I Pad. In future I will avoid using the tube as a disabled passenger. Maybe in time and with practice it would become easier to navigate but this experience has left me disappointed and dissatisfied. UPDATE 20 OCTOBER 2022. My journey to the dental hospital should have been a breeze. It’s my fault for not using the step free symbol to plan my trip. Had I done so taking the Elizabeth Line from Paddington to Farringdon, then transferring to Thames Link for London Bridge. Why oh why did the TFL advisor not use it instead of giving me the wrong information. Why didn’t she recommended this for future trips. Instead she said grab a leaflet which will give you the information you need. As I’ve already explained the symbols are impossible to understand. I now have to wait over a month for another dental appointment.

items.title: Instead of getting refund, I was tricked to lose more
items.review_text:
I wish I read the reviews here before! Extremely bad customer service ever.. paid for travel card zone 1-3; just the following day i figured out i just need travel card from zone 2-3.. (13/09/22) I called customer service to see if i can cancel nd get refund. i was advised ll get refund in 10 days but i need now to buy another card btw zone 2-3.. Perfect.. i bought another travel card nd waited about two weeks.. I did not get any refund nd the original card was not cancelled.. rang them on 26/09 to enquire and i was told i was given wrong advice in the initial call.. I was like what!? Instead of getting refund I was asked to buy another travel card nd paid now total of abt 300£ ..

She told me i need to wait for a month and call again to see if they can refund me!! 

Furthermore, I asked her to  log a complaint because of this inconvenience.. She told she would.. I asked her how this complaint going to be investigated.. She told me she doesn’t know just she logged it not sure if it is going anywhere! I asked her then that i need to speak with a manager/ her manager.. she told me manager no one is available but her manager will call me the following day for sure as she said… No need to say no one called!

 Instead of me saving 60£; They miss-advised me and made me lose more than a hundred along with wasting my time trying to reach them!

items.title: Filthy.
items.review_text:
Filthy.
Populated by animals not human beings.
No security or police anywhere to check on the appalling behaviour of the many commuters: eating disgusting fast food on the trains, putting their feet on the seats (basically cleaning the bottom of their shoes on the seats where other people sit), even putting their feet on the poles which people use to hold themselves up with their hands. Loud and annoying music or sound from trashy noisy films coming from the commuters' phones.
An annoying recorded voice that claims you can call the authorities if you see 'something that doesn't look right': yea, everything!!! But no security around.
Commuters zig-zagging left and right like brainless dogs, instead of walking on their lanes.
Rude and mindless people on the platforms, standing outside the doors, right in front, blocking commuters from getting off the trains.
Stations away from London' centre are as filthy as they get.
Super expensive tickets, the most expensive in the world for the worst service in the world.
Escalators that don't work and they take forever to fix.
A total scam.

items.title: TFL are totally unfair with their…
items.review_text:
TFL are totally unfair with their refund terms and dated technology.

I purchased a month travel card on my Oyster for approx £147. I then had a emergency in the second week which meant I had to fly out.

I phoned assuming they would just cancel and refund the balance.  Oh not that simple with TFL and their Technology.
First they told me they could not cancel my travel card on my Oyster and would have to cancel the entire Oyster Card.
Second they said I would have to pay an admin fee of £5.
Third I would have to buy another Oyster Card at £5.
However the worst was they said I would only get £32 back and when you deduct the £10 fees that works out to only £22 refund from my £147 pounds when only using half the time.
Legal theft. TFL should be ashamed as its not enough that I lose countless money during strikes but also cannot get  a simple refund back of my own money when I have not used the whole travel card period.
They have these unfair terms because they have a monopoly so you have no choice but as you can see its criminal to take advantage of working people.

I refused the insult sum. I have the feeling of being robbed.

items.title: Appauling
items.review_text: Appauling. Avoid travelling in London at all costs. Went to london with my family for the bank holiday and we were alll charged £6 and £5.10 to use the tube two days in a row. items.title: Attending Funeral in London cost me £640
items.review_text:
I've received two PCNs for the ULEZ zone on the 11th December for not paying £12 and filed a "representation" online for both these PCN

I was completely unaware of the ULEZ coming into force, living in Manchester and coming into London rarely - once a year at the most. infect I had not travelled to London since December 2018.
firstly a little background information, I had travelled from Manchester to London with my family, to attend my uncles funeral unaware of the diesel zone, due to the stress and grief I was unaware of the rules due to infrequent travel to London.

After they refuse my appeal I have decided to pay full discounted penalty charge which £160 (Each £60) 

I was sure that I had paid the full amount for both penalty charges and there is nothing outstanding but on again on 31/03/2022 I have receive one more charge certificate from ULEZ with increased to £240 because payment has not been made within the prescribed period and I have only paid fine for single fine.
I have email and call several time London Tribunals but they not able to help because the time period finished.
on 2nd July receive notes of enforcement form Marston Recovery that I own £324 I have call the enforcement office to discuses matter but he not able to help and I have decided to pay £30.
during this period I ma already struggling with my finance situation and been going thru debt management plan to pay off my loans.then another shock the enforcement office banging the door today morning while i am in office my wife call me and she told someone outside say its Police! she open the door and enforcement guy and gentle man Roberts told to pay £529 or he will call police to undertake the goods I have try to call and discussed with him the situation but he was soo rude and bully and refuse to help to continue payment plan due to i have missed one payment.I have go back to citizen advise, council help even call Transport of London and Marston to help to understand my situation but they all advise to speak to Robert he able to set payment plane .i have call back to Robert but gain he not show me favour and bullying like I have done some criminal offence.then i have decided to call Police to understand what is my potions if they attack on my property to recover £60 fine while my small kids around while i been threaten by Robert to enter the home by force like we have done some serious criminal offence finally I have give up because no one show any help or advice and I have paid £640 fine for my London trip. I am currently very upset and feel depressed and got more financial burden.

items.title: The Coldplay Experience
items.review_text:
If 0 stars was an option, I’d choose that. Utterly disgusted by the TFL. Our Coldplay gig was reorganised from the 19th August 2022 to the 21st August 2022 due to the tube  strikes. 
After the concert, they overcrowded the tube stations, causing many to faint and panic. The TFL announced there would be no further trains after around 22:45. It’s amazing how TFL have the balls to cancel the last trains and not run later trains. 
It took us 5 hours to get back to our hotel at Kings Cross. This normally should’ve taken 30-45 mins. Walking around certain parts of London is not safe at that time. 
There was not even an apology from TFL. We were one of the lucky ones that did get back to our hotel. We know people that waited until 5 in the morning to get the first train back.
Not the first time you’ve done this. I know the TFL won’t care and they probably won’t even issue an apology.
I know they won’t learn from this, as it’s happened many times in the past before.
Utterly disappointed with the TFL, and that’s putting it nicely.

items.title: Difficult to use websites for over '60s
items.review_text:
Very poor website experience, misleading advice and sub-standard service.  Their main website gives advice and a link to applying for an Over 60's Photocard, but the process is difficult, frustrating and very time consuming.  

Firstly, the link doesn't work on the main website.  They don't explain that you must apply on a separate Photocard website (had to phone them to find that out).

Secondly, the online photocard application is very difficult to complete if you have impaired eyesight or or suffer dyslexia. You must insert your full 30 digit passport number into 6 boxes.  It's very easy to make a mistake, as those digits are bunched up, not separate entries.

Thirdly, whilst the app does warn you if the passport number is incorrect, it does not warn you of other errors. Therefore, if your date of birth is incorrect.  you will get an error message, but it won't say what is wrong. Instead, it generates a letter to take to the Post Office to check your ID details.  But that won't work either, because if the date of birth is incorrect, the Post Office will reject your application and you lose your £20 fee.  

Fourthly, you must download a passport photo, which must meet very strictly defined rules for appearance and format.  Even if you follow those rules, your photo application can be rejected by automated email without any explanation whatsoever.  If you phone their helpline, they won't give a reason; they'll read off a generic script.

items.title: TfL are out of touch
items.review_text:
TfL are out of touch. They are pricing the poor and working classes and independent businesses out of using London's road as most of us cannot afford new ULEZ compliant vehicles or electric ones nor even have the space or costs of facilities to charge them. When there has been train strikes, heatwaves and their network is down - key workers such NHS staff, firefighters, police, sanitation workers etc who were all holding the city together, working tirelessly and maintaining order (on TfL's sites/ roads etc) did not have their ULEZ or Congestion Fee's wavered so had to pay extortionate fuel fees, parking costs and then a stealth tax for the privilege of getting into a gutty day of work to keep the city going!?!  You could not make that up. Imagine if all these NHS workers, cops, refuse workers, firefighters etc called in sick on those days due to not being able to afford to get to work.
There are various FAKE congestion and ULEZ charge payment sites that TfL warn consumers about which appear at the top of a search engine before TfLs own payment links. I find it hard to believe that a big organisation such as TfL/ Mayor's Office with their weighty legal departments and links to big business, government and Google themselves - cannot get these sites removed or closed down or at least alter their algorhythm?!  If they pursued this with the same vigour as they do chasing fixed penalties or fees from the public then they might have a chance of doing some good!

items.title: Bus 83( London) driver stopped the bus for no valid reason
items.review_text:
Zero stars for Bus line 83 ,route Lycee International (London, Forty Lane,HA9) to Hendon Station (NW4), today 26.06.2022 at 3pm. I was holding the handrail in front of the exit door, because of poor ventilation on this bus - windows really small, and partially closed, and air conditioning non existent. The bus driver had a rant at me because in his imagination people cannot get off the bus(!) if I am holding the handrail. Please note, he saw me moving out of the way when a couple with a baby got off the bus, with the pushchair and everything; he also allowed another young guy to stay in the exact same place I was staying , and he said nothing to him. ( I moved because of his rant).
At Hendon Station he stopped the bus, and said he is not moving untill I get off the bus. I did not do anything wrong, all the other passengers to whom I explained the driver's rant agreed that it was a normal thing to hold the handrail in front of the door. However, this particular bus driver threatened me to call the Police- even if I did not do anything wrong. In this time all passengers got off the bus, he did not give them a transfer ticket and he said he didn' t care. He did not call the Police and he lied about it just to intimidate. Then,when he saw a Police car passing by, he started sounding some allarm he had to get their attention. I got off the bus to see if the Police car would pull over, and if I could speak with them. He immediately closed the doors, and started the bus the second I got off.
Well, it turns out this bus driver totally abused his position (because he could, and nobody will hold him accountable); wasted people' s money and time,as he made everybody wait for no justified reason but his own personal whims, and did not give one single transfer ticket; also, he threatened me to call the Police- even if I did not do anything wrong, but he was immagining things about people not being able to use the hand rail;then he also tried to get the Police to pull over even if he did not even call them. 
I frequently use buses in London, but have never come across such absurd behaviour! For sure it lets a lot to be desired! And it' s not customer service, it' s only this driver' s personal issues, ie : things happening in his mind.  Only for this bus driver delusions -that because of me standing in front of the exit door ( where handrails are actually installed for a reason!!) people cannot use the exit door, or cannot hold the handrail when getting off the bus! All people had to empty the bus, and wait for a new bus to continue their journey because this driver had issues! 
I am not aware in what circumstances a driver can do such things, but if he was capable to stop the bus for no valid reason, and lie about calling the Police, it makes you wonder. 
Anyways, I will make sure to use the buses in London less and less- afterall, the bus fares are paying this individual' s salary, and he allows himself to inconvenience so many people for his imaginary problems with holding the handrail in front of the exit door.

items.title: Very upsetting experience…
items.review_text: London bus services are only going worse! I am so upset! My daughter got very unwell on a way to school so I had  to go on bus 153 to get her back home. She was hardly moving and sat on the first seat a front. Near the end of our journey she needed to throw up and to keep the bus clean and the passengers safe I gave her her school backpack to do so. Our bus stop came and I wanted to take her out from the front door, so she won't throw up all over the bus till she gets to the back door. The bus driver didn't open it and said to go to the back one. I repeated few times that my daughter is very unwell, but he insisted to go to the back, even seeing she hardly moving, and with the most arrogant tone of his voice said 'So what's the problem with the back door?'. This could be his own child...The minute she came out through the back door she nearly collapsed on the ground...It's very upsetting experience and this is not the first time, bus driver has been acting in this manner with us. They need to be trained in customer service, also disabilities awareness, my child is autistic too and the experience deeply upset her. Bus drivers must never forget we trust them with our lives and to treat us back with respect.

items.title: A review of Marcus Blake
items.review_text:
My review is based purely on my interactions with TFL/Heathrow airport employee Marcus Blake.
(I don't know for sure which he worked for)

- 1 hour flight delay
- 90 minute queue for border control at Heathrow
- Underground was closed due to strikes
- My phone died preventing me from booking a taxi

I was stranded, tired and had no way to get home.
Then I had the absolute pleasure of meeting Mr. Blake who walked me back from Heathrow Coach Station to Terminal 2 and lent me his charging bank so that I could order a taxi on my phone.
He chose to miss his bus in order to help me and I truly cannot thank him enough.
He went above and beyond especially considering he was not on shift at the time.
He was always very friendly and managed to buoy my spirits during a pretty stressful situation.

Marcus, thank you - you are a class act.

items.title: Horrendous account creation process
items.review_text:
Horrendous account creation process. I went through the entire process of creating an account and adding cards and security details only to find an ‘error had occurred’. No explanation. I hit the back button a few times to see if I’d entered something incorrectly. A message appeared saying ‘duplicate account’. Well, when I entered my email address why didn’t it tell me at that point? Jesus wept, who designs this process?

So, try to reset password and I have to fill out all sorts of details like an account number that I have no idea what is.

The person who designed this account creation process clearly thanks the only online account people use are the TFL one.

Not only that, try searching ‘pay ULEZ online’ and you will see fake sites, a page on the TFL website warning you about fake sites, but absolutely no easy way explaining how to pay for it. Clicking on ‘pay ULEZ’ actually takes you to a 404-error page not found.

Next thing I’m going to do is search LinkedIn and find out who works in the digital design team at TFL because they really could do with a career break and a break for IT completely and let people in who know what they are doing. These people are utterly clueless.

The street maps, by the way, are a work of cartographic genius, but I suspect that is a very small team within TFL.

items.title: I worked as a mini cab driver for Uber…
items.review_text: I worked as a mini cab driver for Uber since 2015. On my third license renewal they want me to under take “AGAIN” the Topographical Skill test as well as the English Test. As Malcolm Gladwell discussed in his bestseller, “Outliers“, to become an expert it takes 10000 hours. I my self spend 18 000 + hours on the road with 15 000 + trips and rating of 4.98* stars on the Uber platform, but you see TFL will bring you back to year zero for a license that requires an IQ of 90 points. I’m fine and cable of doing other jobs but the problem is, I LOVED LOVED LOVED my job. I had a great pleasure of preforming my job. But you see because they have an agenda against Mini Can drivers for the sake of their grumpy old dangerous unskillful “BLACK TAXI DRIVERS”. It’s been 8 months since I applied for license renewal and  nothing. I see less and less mini cab drivers on the road not only in town but also in areas outside town. Ok…I get it, TFL-( Totally Fu€£ed  London) wants to make the 1st Zone a Black Taxi Heaven, but in general Black Taxis don’t provide service in zone 3,4,5,6,7 and those areas have lack of Mini Cab drivers because of the deliberate scrutiny against the private hire drivers. I guess Totally Fu€£ed  London wants every body depended on their public transport. On other hand they want you to pass an English test Level B1 for a job that requires a level A1 😂😂😂😂. Yet the hole renewal experience is difficult enough, that requires a significant level of English do deal with the hole process. Calling TFL on its own is an expensive thing and sometimes cost you £40 of a phone bill as it takes hours they to answer your calls.

items.title: Ms. Serah (Sarah) Northern Line. Edgware Station. TFL.
items.review_text:
I refer to my Northern Line train journey which terminated at Edgware Station, at 21.05 hours on 14th May 2022.  I was compelled to contact the driver at the end of my journey.  This was easy to do since my journey, as well as the train also terminated at the same station.  The driver gave me her name as Ms. Serah (Sarah!).  
I am at a loss for words of showering enough praise on her for making this one of the most memorable journeys out of the countless ones that I have undertaken with tfl underground services.  My journey from Camden Town upto Edgware station was filled with humour, laughter and joy relating to life, the weather and TfL, through her clear voice announcements throughout the journey.  She made the journey and for a short period, life a breeze.  It was not only me but also the other passengers who enjoyed her pleasant clear crispy voice announcements in the journey.  It was almost unlike what announcements you hear by many other drivers.  Most of which are inaudible and feel like they have been forced to or talking to themselves. 
This lady is joy to travel with and I do hope she gets to be promoted (if there are) to positions whereby she can generate more happiness for the masses.
Personally, I think she would make a very excellent motivational speaker if she ever thought of changing her career.
Although it was a very brief encounter she let me take her picture which will stay in my photo collections for a very long time.

items.title: TfL Online Payment System Failure
items.review_text:
TfL's online payment system to pay for the administration fee of an Oyster Card (60+) is nothing but a complete failure. 

From initial sign up to the year on year admin fee, there has always been a problem with online payment. 

The letter that you get through the door TELLS you that payment online is an option but when you try, there is error after error. 

This time the process will even go as far as communicating with the bank (or app) and then will drop.  

I can only imagine that the online payment 'option' which is 'offered' by TfL is probably to tick the box of 'accessibility' of 'online access' (while not caring at all if it actually works or not)

TfL should either have going to the Post Office as the only form of payment or resolve the online payment issue (and just drop the false charade of 'accessibility'). 

It's that simple.

items.title: The global city with the worst transport service
items.review_text:
The overground line from Stratford is hopeless, there’s constant delays and cancellations, for whatever insignificant reason. And it’s always for external reason somehow -customer action, laves on the track, wind, whatever- so often that it’s actually clear it’s a management issue. Freight trains always have priority at peak hours, so passengers are normally stranded on platforms. Then join overcrowded services. Appalling.

It’s shocking to see how a city like London has such a dreadful transport system. Years of constant underinvestment from the Government (normally, a Conservative one) and customers paying more than enough but somehow still suffering on a daily basis. It’s clearly an issue of mismanagement.

The only thing for customers to do is CLAIM FOR DELAYS, CLAIM AND CLAIM until their finances will call for action. And for senior management to be sacked.

I have either been cut off or the amount requested to be taken by card has been wrong. I am close to tearing my hair out and have now lodged a complaint. I don't think I have ever come across such a dysfunctional organisation.

I literally witnessed a costumer service assistant knitting while seated as if she was in her home, while several other useless plebs standing, blocking the live display while yapping away like morons. They are not even trying to look busy anymore. I mean, who supervises these dummies? 

I pay more than 200 pounds a month for this crummy service and I have had enough! - I will invest in a bike and ride to work from now, rather than paying you another dime. Oh, and Please stop blaming Covid for your lack of consistency, and take responsibility.
