items.title: I have been an user of the Bakerloo…
items.review_text: I have been an user of the Bakerloo line for the last 6 years, from North Wembley to Marylebone from Monday to Friday. Out of curiosity and frustration for how many issues, delays and cancellations this line experiences on a regular basis, I started counting how many days I suffered significant disruptions on my journey resulting in time loss, financial cost and psychological impact on me and the people I care. I can confirm without any doubts this line is significantly disrupted at least 50% of the time, most of the time between Queens Park and Harrow and Welstone, making it completely unreliable. When an issue is temporary it can be disguised as unexpected, when it has been ongoing for at leas 6 years is just purely incompetency and terrible management.

items.title: Trying to amend my Oyster Card details......
items.review_text: My payment card will expire soon, and I've used the Oyster Card website to update the details.  However, I keep getting an error message telling me to contact my bank. I've tried using the contact form, but apparently it can be 10 days before they reply, and whether the reply will be relevant is yet to be seen. What should have been a simple online task has turned into over a week of getting nowhere, so far.  Very disappointing service.

items.title: Worst public transport

items.title: The worst public transport ever
items.review_text: The worst public transport ever! This is London hun? What a joke...

items.title: Could be easily improved with some small changes
items.review_text: There is no timetable for the busses or tubes, so you just have to leave 10-30 minutes early to make sure you get anywhere on time. The busses are very slow because there are almost no bus lanes, but even those few are filled with parking cars. Sometimes the busses and tubes will stop randomly to 'even out the service' even though you had to wait for 10 minutes at the stop. Other times there will be 3 of the same bus one after the other but suddenly its not important to even out the service. If you are waiting at a bus stop and there is a bus there (which isnt your bus) often the bus you are waiting for will just skip the stop even if you are frantically waving. The bus drivers believe they are in formula 1 because there have been multiple occasions where I've almost fallen off my seat or fallen down tbe stairs. The 340 bus always says 'due' at the stop, yet somehow never arrives. The tubes will sometimes not come for 10 or more minutes during peak hours. Noone is enforcing any of the rules, people are pushing themselves through the gates without paying, 60% of people dont wear masks, there have even been people smoking on the trains yet noone did anything. If you tell tfl staff about antisocial behaviour like a passanger harassing others they will pretend to do something but not actually do anything.  The tubes are somehow always suspended due to 'planned works' during the weekend yet dont seem to be any better, while the replacement busses are 10 times as slow and stop in random places that the tube doesn't stop at. But worst of all it doesnt seem like any of the issues that people have with TFL are being worked on or fixed.

items.title: Be careful when going to London
items.review_text:
I travelled from Birmingham to London for a couple hours for a meeting that was next to Marylebone train station. 

Purchased both tickets a month or so in advance. Scanned the ticket QR codes via Apple Watch, making sure I have the right destinaton. 

Went back home and discovered that I have been charged £6 on my BANK ACCOUNT. How and for what? I will never know. 

Registered on their website to apply for a refund, they said they would refund £2.60 as a discount for my next travel! 

So now I have to submit a form and wait 10 WORKING DAYS to see if what was stolen from me will be refunded. 

Be very careful in London, I would suggest to print out your tickets and keep your electronics away from it all as they're clearly robbing people blind and make it difficult for you to reach them. 

Daylight robbery at its best!

Then I tried to call again, and the agent on the phone has been very rude and disinterest to my case. She even told me that if you want to make a complain the information is just on the website, go look it up yourself. 

Right now I feel very hopeless and feeling TFL can just charge me whenever they want with a penalty. I hope to get in touch with someone and take a closer look of my case. I have completely lost my faith for TFL and made me very uncomfortable of traveling to London for the next time.

items.review_text:
Honestly I would like to give -5 stars actually. I topped  up my  oysters card through the Oyster App. The money was taken from my bank account.  The amount was not shown on my Oyster card after it was touched to the yellow card reader on the bus. Calling their customer service, explaining the situation, the answer is; if the amount was not collected it will be refunded in 10 days. … so to be able to travelling in the next 10 days on the TFL services using my Oyster card, I have to invest more money to top up it. 
… and there is no guarantee it will be added to my Oyster card as my previous situation presented it very well, no immediate action can be taken, even the situation is reported, no any compensation is provided regarding the inconveniences.
Perfectly natural the situation needs to be accepted. … so  the -5 stars are earned very well.

Managing Director of TFL and other staff. told file destroyed  . Not good enough. All files could be retrieved . Instead as a registered  disabled person with very serious mobility issues,  TFL cancelled ,without my knowledge the oyster card so I am left with no back up. It could not care less   as is evidenced from the appalling manner which I have been treated and continue to be . Staff on  stations are good but the management is not . It needs to change. items.title: TFL congestion charge rip off
items.review_text:
I got diverted yesterday from the Dartford Crossing to the Blackwell tunnel and saw the signs about ULEZ.
I am not used to driving around London so checked on the website. My car came up as non chargeable for the ULEZ but was ticked for congestion charging.
I duly paid the £15 so as to avoid a fine. A friend suggested that I had not entered the congestion zone so I rang TFL. They could not tell me if I had been in a congestion zone. If I thought I had not been in a chargeable area I could get a credit against another day if I did it today only and pay an extra £2.50.
If I had waited for a letter to say I have been in the zone it is a £160 fine.
What a rip off by TFL, it is an outrageous situation and just a moneymaking machine to hide the bad management and decisions of others. How can you not give me my money back. 
How many other people are being totally ripped off?
I have no desire to visit the London area again.

Congestion charge is £15 and you have 3 days to pay - but they neglect to tell the unaware that if you pay after day one they’ll charge you £17.50. You can’t check if you strayed into the congestion zone or not you just better pay if you think you have. I called to pay the congestion charge and they told me the van wasn’t mine and they couldn’t take payment. This was a new employee who got it wrong but they still sent me a PCN. Try speaking with someone! Impossible. I hate TFL more than I hate dog sh** on the pavement. Imagine working for them and having to put TFL on your CV. Embarrassing or what.

The service is absolutely terrible, drivers are rude and don't know how to communicate in the slightest , not to mention i have experienced drivers literally walk off the bus during their shift to go for a cigarette, or because of a driver swap, just leaving the bus in the middle of nowhere. But above all, it is the companies greed that make them unbearable. As a student , i have no other option than to pay for monthly tickets through TFL to get to uni. In the duration of one term i have lost more than £400 through this tragic company. They failed to send me my student oyster card which makes travel cheaper and also had my tram past on there, due to an ' error in the system.' They haven't answered any of my emails asking for possible reimbursements and they continue to take more money out of my account due to ' unpaid fares' in which i have none, they are literally robbing me.

items.title: Tax payers money wasted
items.review_text:
I would like to start my review asking everyone, how in a modern Britain we still find places like TFL and TPH? Why? 

Many bad reviews and nobody replying them? Why? 

The answer is simply? Too much money available, tax payer’s money wasted because in the end there will be more 💷available. 
If TFL would be a private company, its staffs would care much more about everything. 

Yet again, lots of TFL’ staffs are counting the days for retirement, they do not give a s**t about anything anymore,  not respecting timeframes, careless about  spending and so on..  

Unfortunately the actual government does not care much about it I guess and therefore there always will be money from central government available for them..tax payers one by the way.. wasted. 

Increasing fees and services fee a lot every year will not solve this problem? 
It will create anger throughout communities without solving anything. 

A strong leadership, competent people, workers who really want to work respecting the rules and following the protocols would be a good start for TFL gain respect and trust again within communities. 

Wondering if TFL would care about my review and others one written down below?

It is time for some authorities fire those dinosaurs out of public jobs and tell them “go whistle” and grab staffs who respects its duties and actually work!

items.title: Scumbags money grabbers
items.review_text: ULEZ!!  I was taking my wife into work a few weeks before Xmas as there were constantly delays on the trains. I was taking her Into FORE street Edmonton. I knew a little about ULEZ but didn't realise that half of fore street is in the ULEZ area and half is not.( how silly does that sound) On Xmas eve I received 1 letter from TFL stating I have a fine for ULEZ. When I called them up they said I had another 4 fines amounting to £400 !! I stated that I have only received 1 fine letter and none for the others and that i haven't had anything else. Common sense would tell you that If you had a fine for going to the same road you wouldn't travel there again and if I had known sooner I would not have gone. When i made an appeal they said its been rejected and you have to pay £400 pounds even though I received 1 letter at the time. The lack of empathy and common  sense from TFL was shocking and made me utterly speechless. Even if they said you can pay half the fine or at least 1 that's fair enough but to punish me and making me pay £400 pounds just after Xmas was shocking. These morons don't have a clue and will take your money under any circumstances.They need to Look at the terrible reviews from  customers and start treating people with empathy and respect.

items.title: Rude and mean bus driver
items.review_text:
There is a bus stop right outside my house, and it was morning and my mum and two younger brothers were going to catch a bus to get my youngest brother to school. As we were eating breakfast my mum noticed that the next bus was in 1 minute, and the one after in 15 minutes. If we caught the 15 minute one, it would mean my brother would be late, so we stopped eating, grabbed his coat and bag, and tried to get outside as quickly as possible to catch the 1 minute bus. 
My brothers and I just managed to get outside in time as the bus arrived, however, my mum was just getting her bag. We said to the driver, "Our mum is just getting her bag, and she'll only be a second. Our house is just here, please can you wait?" The bus stop is just outside the house, so the driver knew that my mum would only be a few seconds, but didn't want to wait anyway. He quite rudely shook his head at us but didn't say anything, so we were a bit annoyed and tried to linger on the bus for a second as I could see my mum running out of the door, but when the driver started waving his arms angrily at us, I picked up my youngest brother and me and my other brother got off the bus. I had pointed at my mum and said, "She's just here!" as my mum ran towards the bus, but the driver shut the doors in our faces and drove off.

items.title: No access to my account
items.review_text:
My employer has changed a policy and I can now claim back some Oyster journeys. I just need a screen shot of the journeys / payments. Great. My card is already registered and I have an account so this should be easy. I forgot my password as I seldom access online. I was prompted through security questions and then told to phone a 0343 telephone number. I phoned, pressed numbers on my phone to go through options, but no one actually answered my call. I email a complaint and get a generic reply from a person called Jay telling me how to register my card and change my password, which is what I have attempted and complained about. I go round in circles. 

But, the email says I ‘can’ access travel details……
but only journeys in last 7 days. W.T.F?They can supply 7 days worth, but not the past 12 months? Now I’m being ignored. 

Does the TFL management actually look at these reviews or ignore them, put fingers in their ears and spout “la la la la” and just take their salaries? For something so simple to rectify, I think the admin / IT support is crap.

items.title: For one of the most expensive public…
items.review_text: For one of the most expensive public transport services in Europe, if not in the world, this constantly under delivers. If it's slightly too hot there are problems, if there's one drop of snow they break down. How do countries like Switzerland or Japan with similar fares manage??? By being reliable! I am on my way home late at night and basically I have been told that they are stopping service midway because maybe there might be a person on the track and all services are cancelled. Now as a single woman being dropped in the middle if nowhere at 11:30pm is great for personal safety, NOT! Sort this out please! Paris, Tokyo, Barcelona and Brussels are cities where I lived and used the 'tube' they all do better than TFL.

items.title: I entered the congestion zone on 18…
items.review_text:
I entered the congestion zone on 18 November and paid £17:50 on 19 November when I set up my TFL account. According to TFL I have paid for 19 November instead of 18 November and issued me an £80 penalty charge notice. £97:50 paid in total. When I initially paid the £17:50 my TFL account acknowledged payment but didn't tell me it was the wrong date. My TFL account stated "no outstanding charges" after payment. TFL officials say they are standing by their penalty charge notice because I chose the day after instead of the day before. Furthermore they won't reimburse me for the £17:50 they acknowledge was the wrong day of travel and their congestion charge was not applicable on that day. 

We are dealing with mercenaries enforcing a stealth tax. When will the general public wake up and recognise we are under oppression by a fascist dictatorship. The opposition are communists waiting to seize power. Not much choice is there?

She informed me that I can put in a complaint about her and put the phone down. When I looked up the complaints department guess where it goes yes customer services. By her saying this just goes to show that nothing will happen. All I want to do is purchase a Annual travel card.

items.title: Awful website for paying congestion…
items.review_text:
Awful website for paying congestion charges etc.
I'm coming to London on one visit and am not familiar with London at all. I went through a very long winded process to set up an account then added the address I am visiting and for some reason I'm meant to know what inner and outer ring roads and a like mean on relation to this address! I don't live in London so haven't a clue. I am shown a lovely map with coloured lines on with an arrow signalling the address but nothing to say what they mean except for zones like inner and outer. Is this CC or ULEZ or the other one. Can't even remember what that is called. Is it too much to ask for me to pop in the postcode then go to a page where TFL tell me what I have to pay? And then I pay? Instead I'm guessing and so will pay all three as I don't want a fine. To everyone funding this website through, I'm guessing very high fees on a daily basis, I feel for you. I really do. It took me 10 mins to pay my local congestion charge. What's up TFL?

When you call to raise the issue the support team will firstly try and bat you between fleet or discount team and then will say they have 'no visibilty' of the progress of the application and that it's with the back office. Who of course you can't talk to. I get this issue EVERY month.

items.title: Public transport in London is very…useful.
items.review_text: Public transport in London is very frequent and gets me from A to B. I mainly use buses these days. I don't know how the drivers stand it having to deal with the public and drive in busy London streets. It seems very stressful and difficult to me but years ago a bus company would not take my application to be a driver any further because of my medicine. (And No, I am not entitled to a Freedom Pass or benefits). Thank God I don't drive anymore and perhaps I would have a different view of tfl if I had to pay congestion charges. TFL are a vital, useful service for me and for others. Not that I ever voted for Sadiq Khan. I vote Conservative. And when London had its referendum back in 1999 on whether to have a London mayor I voted No. But I can't say I've got anything against tfl.

So yeah… also the website is still broken so they’re annoying for allowing that to happen.

Also, can they FINALLY allow card owners to make a customised payment for their oyster card so we don’t have to always spend £5 every time we have to top up.

items.title: Awful lousy useless atrocious service !!!!

So infuriating as I cannot speak to anybody. The virtual queue is not a queue as no one contacts you back. I left a message, when I got a bland response it still did not assist. An atrocious Kafkaesque experience!

items.title: I can't wait for this company to go…

items.title: Worst customer experience ever!
items.review_text: Worst customer experience ever!! Their online system to put credit on zip card is so glitchy, I have tried numerous times to put credit on my kids cards and despite over £45 taken from my bank no credit on their cards. I then get email to call for refund after nearly 2 hours of holding I request call back and twice line goes dead when they eventually do call back. Finally got hold of someone today after a weeks failed efforts to process refunds and he processed refund but then said my payment of yesterday which I thought had gone through may need to be refunded too as sometimes payments go through sometimes they don’t but if not I’ll get another email asking me to call. So yet again I will have to commit to untold hours of holding to get my £10 refunded 😡😡. All customer agents working from home  on crappy phone lines that are poor signal with bad feedback etc online and systems don’t work but we have to chase refunds. Kids Can’t even put credit on cards at station machines as they say there is a fault and no one in office. So frustrating 😡😡😡😡

items.title: How can
items.review_text:
How can, what is essentially a huge (even in global terms) transport network, not have staff answering the phone and STILL all working from home ???

I am trying to up-date an Oyster card (and have been for 2 weeks now) with little or no help even when I do manage to get hold of someone. They all tell me they are unable to help as they are working from home...........Then get your backsides into the office and start doing the job for which you are paid !!!

In the meantime I am having to take my daughter to AND from school as the bus drivers refuse to let her on without a valid pass. How is she supposed to produce a valid pass when there is no help.

As a caveat, we are unable to log on to our account as it says they do not have not have valid information to enable me to do so !!!

Anyone else out there feel the same..................???

Anyone else feel that this might have something to do with the "celebrity boss" in charge.............???

Is this man truly fit for such a role..............?

items.title: The most useless service EVER
items.review_text: The most useless service EVER! What a shame for a big company such as TFL!

items.title: Shambolic 60+ Oyster Card Replacement Service
items.review_text: I had recently damaged my 60+ Oyster card and  ordered and paid for a new one online on 16/9/21. (3-5 days delivery-possibly 10 days due to Covid!!). It didn't arrive by 4/10/21, so I emailed and phoned Customer Services. After waiting for a 'call back' I went through the details and was initially told there was no record of the application. They finally agreed that I had applied/paid for a replacement. A new card would be with me within 3-5 days. Guess what. No card after a further 8 days. Called again (and another wait for a call back) and got NO help from their shambolic excuse for a Customer Services Dep't. I now have to wait 3-5 days for a response as to why I still haven't received my card. Sorry that I can't leave no stars.

items.title: Really bad customer service
items.review_text: Really bad customer service, Waiting over 2 months for a refund, having to constantly chase and then told they have no record of a ticket image despite them receiving all other emails before and after.  If I've heard nothing then guess what, I have to ring again and go through the whole loop.  Absolutely appalling - TFL, be ashamed.

items.title: The 18+ oyster card discount
items.review_text: The 18+ oyster card discount doesn’t apply unless weekly or monthly, therefore it charges you like an adult for journeys that majority of uni students take, which is once or twice a week! there’s no point buying a 18+ oyster card at all if you’re not in on campus 24/7; it’ll cost you the same price and you’ll save £20 from not ordering one🙄

items.title: Shocking service
items.review_text: Shocking service. Absolutely terrible. Refuse to answer your call. Tried several times giving up after 30 mins each time. Can request ringback. 4 hours later phone rings, you answer it, and line immediately goes dead. Wow. So so bad

I have waited for over an hour just to get through to some one. They are rude and abrupt. After waiting for 10 days for a refund, I’m now being  advised to wait again.

items.title: Furthermore to my complaint on how I…
items.review_text: Furthermore to my complaint on how I have to wait over four weeks to receive my child’s bus pass only for me to get a call from tfl that unfortunately I have to apply for a new one,I have to apply for a new one because “THEY ARE TOO BUSY” this is what they said after asking me to send a proof via post to them, this is what the caller said to me even though she also admitted she saw I have also uploaded the same proof again on online. I have been paying for my child to get on the bus to school  for the past five weeks not to mention how many time I called tfl almost everyday and nobody helped me. I have been charged for previous application and the caller with audacity said if I think I have been charged, “THEY MIGHT RECONSIDER” making a fool of me with such statement. Spending close to £70 on transportation for a little child to be able to go to school like other kids do is absolutely ridiculous, discrimination against myself and my child is definitely unacceptable.

items.title: I have been applying for a 16+ card for…

items.title: Needed to catch a train from Wanstead…
items.review_text: Needed to catch a train from Wanstead park with my newborn asleep in a buggy. Only step access to the platform at this particular station. So I asked a tfl staff member, sitting in a booth at the station, sign posted ‘assistance’. He begrudgingly got out of the booth, and explained, only if I removed the baby, would I be able to have assistance! A newborn sleeping, as she is too heavy! I mean, are you for real? If there is no assistance, for lone parents, then you need to install a lift for access! I attempted the stairs alone, with no apology or qualms from the tfl ‘assistant’, before a kind fellow passenger kindly offered his help. Shame on you TFL and your overpaid, miserable and unhelpful staff!

items.title: If I could,I would give it a zero
items.review_text:
If I could,I would give it a zero. I keep having problems with my daughters’ photo cards. I set up an auto top up but it doesn’t work which means that,on several occasions, the girls couldn’t travel back home as there was no credit in their photo cards as the auto top up didn’t kick in. I then called Oyster and they sorted it out. They promised me the auto set up was back and running  again.
It happened again a couple of times. The girls ran out of credit on their photo cards again. Just now I’ve tried to sort it out online but I cannot login. I keep getting a Message saying “wrong password” so I tried and reset the password but I received no email to do so.
It is extremely unsettling. Really unfair. The girls are now anxious about travelling. And I have no idea how to sort it out as it doesn’t seem to
Work. Can TFL not get a grip on their website? It’s disgraceful as travelling in London is very expensive so TFL should run smoothly and their website needs  sorting out. I will
Make a
Formal
Complaint.

items.title: Non-existent customer service
items.review_text: On 29th September 2021 I applied online for a 16+ photo oyster card for my son. I paid the required £20 then got a message saying something went wrong. 3rd October 2021, 4 days later the oyster Web account is still showing awaiting payment, even though my bank account shows the money has left my account. I called customer services for 2 days running, spending up to 1hour waiting for the call to be answered, no answer. This is shockingly unethical service. I am now left with the decision of setting up a new account and paying another £20 hoping that it goes well this time, or letting my 16years old son pay the full fare to get to and from college and hope on the wind that this will be mysteriously sorted. I am really disappointed and disgusted by this experience.

items.title: Baker Street shut on night service.
items.review_text:
So, having finished work at 2.30 am having done a 19 hour day I walked a fair distance to Baker Street to get my first night tube home. I arrived to find all the gates locked. 
I checked again on line.. ALL STATIONS ON THE JUBILEE WILL BE OPEN ALL NIGHT. 
So basically, that's a lie... Because I am here now, tired and hungry and not happy. Thanks TFL. FOR NOTHING

items.title: Sadly I can’t give it less than one…
items.review_text: Sadly I can’t give it less than one star.  Trying to apply for a 60+ Oyster card and it is impossible doing it on line. Going to try and phone but don’t hold out much hope.

items.title: The worst.
items.review_text: I work in a school and provided my students with the possibility of ordering a +18 students card. What a mess. Some applied on 1/09 and still haven't received their Oyster Card to this day. Some applied, receive their Oyster Card paid +£300 and the card is simply not working. They have been using their debit card to travel when they were promised a 30% discount. They tried to go to stations but always had the same answer: phone TFL. When they try to phone TFL they have to wait 4 to 5 hours to get someone on the line. The employees are useless. They do not know what they're doing, each time it's a different answers when there's an actual answer. Request a refund? They hung up on me... Give the Oyster Card number? Put on hold for 2hrs then got hung up on. One agent literally told me he didn't know how to request a refund then hung up. Promised a refund in 4 to 5 working days? It's been 20 days - no refund. This is a disgrace and I know that they don't care as they have the monopoly in London. We're literally being hold hostage. They do not have enough staff, the staff is clearly not trained AT ALL and they just don't care.

items.title: Award for worst customer service
items.review_text:
I'm not one to leave reviews or even bad reviews, however after calling up TFL 4 times to sort out my student photocard and got nowhere I might as well. TFL can provide poor customer service because they are a monopoly in London. And there's nothing we can do about that.

1. The call wait times are ridiculous. I waited 3-4 hours each of the four times I called. They say they are experiencing high call volumes but the truth is they don't have the staff to cope with it.
2. The issue I'm trying to fix is simple. The photo card they gave me expired a week from when I ordered it, when it should expire the following year. I have one year left at university. Each time I called, each telephone operator had a different approach, some had no idea what to do, there's no consistency. Each time I called I was put on hold and the phone just cut out. My problem is still unresolved.
3. They might as well not have the service at all, it's just a time wasting service.

items.title: To call their customer service useless is an understatement.
items.review_text:
1. This should really be no stars. I had an apprentice photocard for 2019/2020 but wasn't able to use up the balance due to lockdowns. There was no notification that it had expired. I tried to contact them many times, most recently September this year, as I'm still doing an apprenticeship so I have little money coming in, but my travel costs have increased. 
2. My Apple Pay stopped working and again, I had no luck with advice on what was happening or how I could pay for my travel. 
3. I applied for a photocard and heard nothing - apparently I'm not an apprentice (would love my wages to reflect this belief!)
4. Bought an oyster card instead and that has been working for a few weeks but I now can't make any top ups. No one at TfL spoke to me - I gave up after being on hold for 2 hours 13 minutes whilst at work. Thankfully my bank were more help and none of the pending transactions are actually going through.
5. I've applied for a different photocard where I've struggled to pay for the fees with the salary changes and again - heard nothing!
6. Just to add it while I'm here - why can't stations update passengers on where trains are, any delays, or any information at all? I don't often carry my crystal ball when commuting but don't appreciate being a young girl at silly hours of the morning trying to get from A to B via any station I can. Train staff mocked me for missing my train, bearing in mind I'd been sat on the platform for 30-40 minutes and only saw a bunch of pigeons. Funnily enough the pigeons didn't have a Central Line train.

items.title: Exceedingly disappointed
items.review_text:
Exceedingly disappointed 
I reached the grand old age of 60 recently and have spent the last three months trying to get a 60+ oyster card to prove it and spent numerous hours trying on the phone. Not much of a hobby I know but at least we have the pandemic. I am known as Steve but on my driving licence it is Steven. Registered on the website but would not take my driving licence number. Printed off the verification page and went down the post office. Amazingly post master would not accept the different names.
OK back to TFL portal. I could not now change my name by adding an N. Rang up. I have to create a new Email and sign up again.
Managed to create a new Email account. Registered printed off verification sheet paid £20 and waited. 
The wait was not long and within a week I received.....a letter stating that my driving licence details were different online from what I had given the Post Office. Mmmm isn't that why you use the verification system, because you can't load documents. I dont believe I had entered my driving licence number.
No worries ring up again. helpful person the other end of the phone got me to complete a form to say you have a problem. That was on 11th September 2021. I sent a picture of my driving licence with the number visible.
Got an enquiry number. Rang up on 24th did not know anything about the enquiry number would get someone to contact me back. No callback and no response so called again today
Just spoken to someone who could not get over the fact I have two photocard accounts, but did say I had made payment. She tried to be helpful. Wanted me to go down the post office and use the verification letter. Groundhog day. 
Said I wanted to complain. 
She advised me to complete the same enquiry form that I have not received a response from the 11th September. Today is 27th September and you still have my £20. Just want an  60+ Oyster photocard with the picture I  have uploaded  twice.

items.title: TFL.... A rotten organisation to the core
items.review_text:
Paid £15 congestion charge for Sunday and £15 for Monday
Got a fine for £80 saying I paid for Sunday and Tuesday. Told them your cameras have me in the congestion zone for two days and I have paid two days. Must have been an error on website on which days it paid for. Had to pay £80 fine and they kept £15 I paid for “Tuesday” knowing full well the payment was for Monday. Customer service agents trained to give zero service and advice and were the total opposite of helpful. Worst organisation in the government by far full of inept people and backward systems. If you dont pay or forget to pay £15 you get fine for £80. Thats 5 x the original amount and 136% increase. It all ok if its tfl doing this! If it was a private company they would get prosecuted for extortion. My case is clear. I paid two days and I was in the congestion zone two days. The website is built in a way that does not inform customers if they have entered the congestion zone and need to pay. You enter the wrong day if your dyslexic and they have no sympathy or mercy. Hope TFL are proud of themselves. A rotten organisation to the core

items.title: Yet again I waste a couple of hours…
items.review_text:
Yet again I waste a couple of hours trying to work my way thru the clunky maze that's tfl's website trying to do what I've been ordered to do (revalidate an address) only to discover no option to do that very thing. Four attempts to get thru to a human on the 'phone ("..... unprecented number of calls ..." etc.) only to get surly woman who could not be less interested.
Appalling bunch and they should be ashamed. Just rubbish.

items.title: Congestion Charging:- Why can’t TFL…
items.review_text: Congestion Charging:- Why can’t TFL give road users an opportunity to pay the standard congestion charge of £15 when missed, especially if it’s the first time? I’ve just been slammed with £80 PCN, no. TZ6176408A for driving through St George’s road, as if it was deliberate! Will a sane person deliberately incur a PCN? I’ve always known about nil congestion charges during the weekend but slapping me with a fine because of what I do not know without giving me the opportunity to pay the actual charge of £15 in my opinion is pathetic

items.title: TFL need improvements
items.review_text: I drove through London after many years. The road signage is confusing and there are so many that it makes driving hazardous and risky. I avoid using public transport pre COVID because it is overcrowded and very very expensive. The poor are being out-priced and it’s wrong. There was a lot of traffic so Google map re routed me but I came home and paid the congestion charge today as I saw a sign but because I was driving past it I did not have time to read it to be sure. So I searched on the TFL website for a way to confirm their cameras picked up my registration but I could not find a way to check. I signed up for an account so I paid the congestion charge just to be on the safe side  in case TFL send me a penalty charge. Now reading the reviews it looks like I may not get a refund when I call TFL tomorrow to explain to them what and why I did!  Also they need to realise that their opening hours to help customers needs to be extended and they have to understand customers who paid to enter the congestion zone but did not enter it should get a refund. It is unacceptable and immoral of TFL to hold on to customers money for their own gains.

items.title: every bus i’ve got on this week alone…
items.review_text: every bus i’ve got on this week alone has either terminated early, broken down or been delayed for over 20 minutes. i’m having to leave 2 hours early everyday for a 45 mins journey.

Cancelled because they don't have enough trains,because all of them are rubbish,and they need to be repaired??? It's that a stupid joke or they take us like some stupid peoples?

items.title: Horrible and unreliable
items.review_text: Horrible and unreliable. 2021 in a city like London and the public transport is being serviced by this piece of hot trash

items.title: Shukri matan was so wonderful
items.review_text: Shukri matan was so wonderful. I was left in Langley Berks station alone when I was travelling from Twyford to Paddington but after an incident on the train leaving me Isolated I felt completely safe on the platform with Shukri. Never before have I been met with such kindness in the evening on the train. Thank you so much Shukri, it’s not everyday that you feel appreciated and welcomed at a station. Shukri is one of the most kindest members of TFL I’ve ever met and I truly hope his work is recognised and appreciated. Thank you so much

items.title: I am writing the review for staff at…
items.review_text: I am writing the review for staff at London Bridge this morning and also Tower tube station early afternoon. Outstanding service and assistance given. Well down you all!

items.title: They have you by the balls and they…
items.review_text:
They have you by the balls and they know it. 

If you accidentally pay the congestion charge for the wrong day, not only will they not credit it against the correct day, but they will also refuse to refund your accidental payment. 

Daylight robbery.

items.review_text: Ripping off hauliers even when they have complied with all the new regulations. Despicable.

items.title: Your representation portal is hella buggy!
items.review_text: Fragile website that 80% of the time won't allow you to make online representations against a penalty charge.  No rhyme or reason to when it will accept the representation and when it will give 'Sorry, something's gone wrong' at the end of the process.  Diabolical for such a large organisation.  Impossible to report this problem - you just a get a generic reply from a bot.

TFL are not above the law, but go around bullying hard workers for more money and refusing to accept charges have been paid.

items.title: Got a PCN ticket after entering the…
items.review_text: Got a PCN ticket after entering the congestion charging zone even though I had an auto pay account set up. Turned out I put in an o instead of a 0 on my registration number by mistake. Then refused to cancel my PCN even though it was obvious it was an honest mistake. The people that work for this company are incredibly mean spirited and have no shame. I hope they are in a similar situation one day and someone else is just as mean to them..

items.title: I paid for ULEZ and Congestion a day…
items.review_text:
I paid for ULEZ and Congestion a day after entering the zone. I was sent 2 fines £80.00 each. On speaking to them they refused to cancel them because according to them I selected the wrong day. Despite having a receipt of payment. They also refused to refund the money I paid stating its non refundable. The site is very misleading. Be careful
What is worst is that I have 4 children £200 is a lot to lose to TFL just greedy.

items.title: Canary Wharf shut again!!!
items.review_text: I don’t understand why it shows good service on a jubilee line on each app you can get when the jubilee is shut - Canary Wharf station again!!!!! (not the first experience in the past week ) prior to closing hours. Sort your lines out online!!! I understand that the line need to be shut for whatever reason but without updating it online how can we know????  Not great 🤬😡

items.title: tfl CC "Planned Maintenance" is big revenue raiser.
items.review_text: I drove through London Congestion Charge Zone on Sat 24th July. Fee = £15. When I got home that evening I attempted to pay online but couldn't as their system was down for planned maintenance and wouldn't reopen until 7 am Sun 25 July. When  I attempted to pay on Sunday they stick me with an added £2.50 for not paying on the day of travel. Nowhere on their site did I see an alt way to pay. I emailed on Sun to query the uplift with no reply whatsoever. I called on Mon 26 July and was virtually threatened with a PCN if I didn't pay by midnight Tuesday. I explained the situation and said that I even had a screenshot of the message regarding planned maintenance. That fell on deaf ears. Whomever I was dealing with had zero interest in helping. I was also told that any email enquiry or application for refund/review will take up to TEN WEEKS just to get a response. Lord knows how long it would take to get any actual action.  I am beginning to see tfl as nothing more than a money-grabbing organisation with little regard for the communities it is suppose to be helping. Pathetic response to a reasonable request.

items.title: Close to 3 h to wait for a bus
items.review_text: Close to 3 h to wait for a bus. Online no issues about bus 13 but in almost 3 h not a single bus has pass. And if someone will say why i didn't travel with something else... well the answer is that i had a  heavy parcel. Shame on u tfl.

items.title: Every Day (this week)
items.review_text: I have not been able to commute into or from work (Amersham - Kings Cross) via the Met line one day this week without delays, having to change trains (from a fast train to slow train) or station closures. Get your act together TFL, none of the staff have been helpful in explaining the situations, IF this is due to heat then say something don’t just leave people sitting in trains with no clues as to what is happening..... sort your infrastructure out WE GIVE YOU FAR MORE THAN ENOUGH MONEY TO.

items.title: Are we safe on tfl?
items.review_text: If you travel on tfl then be aware, tfl do not have any reguard for there customers safety this is not top priority, they don’t want to take responsibility which is scary and damaging considering the amount of people that use this service and unfortunate things can happen in or out of the underground station. I  have been injured by a loose panel. Hanging away from the celling from a tfl stair way leading into the station, and even tho I have photo evidence and it was seen by the station manger confirming the defect. They still refuse to except responsibility. They failed to keep a accident book which is required from all businesses with more then 10 members of staff which they clearly have more then. To add insult to injury they taped off the area and got workmen to fix the loose panel with no screws. This is a disrespectful act. And needs immediate attention. If safety is not a priority on our transport service then tfl should be closed and the transport contract should be given to another company or group that can assure and provide better safety for all of there paying customers. Before many more people get hurt. Please like if you have had a similar issue.

items.title: HORRIBLE  !
items.review_text:

SHAME ON YOU ,CROOKS !

items.title: Bring in the competition & get these clowns OUT
items.review_text:
I've been complaining for over a year to TFL about their drivers revving their engine's outside our residential houses. TFL take about 2 months to reply to complaints with a note sorry we are having a high level of complaints to deal with (I WONDER WHY!! - incompetent /Uneducated nonsense people) and then send out a generic answer they have copied and pasted saying not their staff when it is or re-asking for the same info sent in  1st complaint - 6 weeks ago! -  which included the time reg. number - date and bus number!   after that has been supplied they go away for another month or more -  and return either saying they cant locate the bus (REALLY! - with the reg. - time date location  and bus number!) or without checking have replied not our bus company when it is.  Is this public funds paying these clowns a salary? The government should take action. They operate like the wild west.

They are a serious disgrace. Should get an award for the most incompetent disgraceful company  in the UK. ill trained - totally ignorant staff with a  total lack of concern for the public. Revving engine's at 6am and after 11 at night. When i have gone out to speak to the drivers - they have said I have to clean my engine and let it run? 6AM  11PM? - Totally ignorant behaviour.  Directly facing residential homes.  I look forward to the day they get competition and get ousted out. They are a TOTAL DISGRACE to the UK - and should not be allowed to serve the public.

Doesn’t make any sense. Does they really know London? Please give them more training. Looks like the guy is in the dark.

items.title: Broken Lift @ London Bridge-Thanks "Mus"
items.review_text: Took my deaf/disabled brother from High Barnet to Guys Hosp. only to discover the lift in London Bridge was out of order. Driver at HB kindly asked me where we were getting off in order to give us more time, he obviously wasn't aware of the lift situation. However when we got to LB we were put back on the tube to Elephant & Castle & TFL paid for a taxi to the Hospital. On the way back from LB the lift still out of order so TFL kindly paid for a taxi to King's Cross. But I want to mention the young guy Mustafa "Mus" who literally walked all the way to where the taxi was picking myself & my brother up to take us to KC. Nothing was too much trouble for him. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because of the lift situation. Thanks TFL for looking after us so well on the day & making our journey less stressful & big thank you to "MUS" Lorri

items.title: How hopeless is TFL?
items.review_text: Arranged a delivery to London postcode and agreed with driver I would pay rip off charges but website is hopeless. Unclear if postcode was LEZ or ULEZ and said congestion charge was not same as LEZ but then only charged me for congestion charge. I am uncertain whether I have paid in full or still owe for LEZ. I guess I will find out if a snotty penalty charge notice arrives. Customer service phone number is hopeless. Just another good old British example of hoping you have slipped up and it costs you.

items.title: It is an amazing day.
items.review_text:
It is an amazing day.
I were on my way to work today and I met Gabriella TFL staff member on Gidea Park station at 6:00a.m in a morning.
Gabriella is professional and informative, as well as that she is open to help. I noticed her smiling eyes and it was very nice. 

It's so important to meet the right person on your way to work and to be this good person like Gabriella.

items.title: If someone can explain me why in rush…
items.review_text: If someone can explain me why in rush hour ( morning and evening) on some of the lines there is 4-5 min. gap between the trains in underground. Pretty much the same as off pick, just cost us double? Is not that the idea of rush hour- paying more for more frequently trains? And if TFL can't provide better service why is keep changing extra? Particularly with Central line when most of the time there is two trains to Hainault branch and one to Eping you have to wait between 15 and 20min. for train. You can imagine how full the trains are getting.

items.title: Money grabbing tools
items.review_text: Giving one star is nice… you type of people are not understanding at all. My poor partner never even knew about his congestion charge cause they were sent to a bitter ex girlfriends address and she never told us. You told us we’d win our appeal but instead your challenging it all because he should of got in contact sooner, how the hell can he when he never knew about the letters in the first place. You people don’t understand that money is tight rn and threatening to send enforcement agents to my house when I’m in recovery for drugs and mental health, has caused nothing but hell for me. You want almost £400 when in times like this money is tight. Your all money grabbing tools as are your enforcement companies, none of you have manners which I’m sure you were raised to have. Absolutely fuming and disgusted with this!

items.title: Corrupt overpaid
items.review_text:
Corrupt overpaid, inept organisation. The slogan every journey matters, is a total lie. Only cyclists matter, everyone else, the 99% have been totally forgotten. They've ruined lives by stealling our time, they've made it more dangerous, by creating more frustration and taken away all accountability from cyclists, also forcing vehicles to constantly u turn to avoid gridlock or overcome blockades or no turns.
They've narrowed roads, built bollards, flower pots, road narrowing, extra traffic lights, removed major roundabouts which worked and replaced them with traffic nightmares, paved over bus stops then rebuilt them in the middle of the road to block traffic, made more clutter on the road with stupid cycle ways and made many cycle lanes hidden behind park cars, bus stops, zebra crossings, They've built cycle lanes on major roads, like the Western avenue or Park Lane, lowered the speed limit to 20 to make money even tho its proven to create more accidents in case studies as cyclists keep undertaking turning cars. They have utterly destroyed London, made it unliveable. I have been forced to make plans to leave London, for my stress and health, thats how bad tfl are. 1 star is 6 stars too many. -5.
 p.s Tfl are the worst company in London by far.

items.title: Greenwich road alterations are an…
items.review_text:
Greenwich road alterations are an absolute disgrace.  It has become impossible to go about everyday business.  The cycle lanes take up a third of the road and are not in use in general.  The pavements are unsafe for pedestrians because cyclists and scooters prefer them to the cycle lanes.  Cars, vans buses are at an absolute standstill.  Trying to cross at main junctions has now become so dangerous that it is safer to cross between stationary vehicles in jams. 
 Why were residents not consulted before this work was carried out?  When are our views going to be considered?  We pay more than our fair share of taxes and costs but are totally ignored.

items.title: Greenwich roads make living here miserable
items.review_text: The changes implemented to roads in Greenwich have been done so badly congestion increased, stress increased, probably pollution increased as a result. So many local people's lives made harder and more unpleasant. Its so hard to get to do a weekly shop. Loads of people don't have time to shop for food one bag at a time, there has to be a way to shop locally for a whole weekly shop. No buses near me to go to the shopping/supermarket area. Bring tubes properly to South East London rather than waste huge amounts of public money blocking off essential routes. It is depressing to allow greenwich council to fine local people £7million (what they have budgeted to receive from ltn fines) whilst implementing ltn's. It is truly miserable living here.

items.title: I love my 193 but don’t ever leave anything
items.review_text:
I love my little 193 bus route.  So frequent and reliable.  Unfortunately I had a few bags and accidentally left one on a bus.  I knew immediately after I’d disembarked.  So I followed the bus on the app and less than 50 mins it returned.  I’d left food eg bread, chocolates etc but most of all I was so upset that I’d left my ‘Karen’ fold/zip purple bag there, as it was a pressie from my best friend.  
There was nothing on that or other buses and driver’s policies were to throw away food.  Really!  Less than an hour later?
I rang North Street garage, pleasant lady, but nothing found.
I reported my mistake but I’ve heard nothing else.
Warning - don’t leave anything on these buses!

items.title: Outstanding Service
items.review_text:
I used the 315 bus route Saturday 5th June ...arriving in Balham approx 3 20 pm
Bus no 8162
Buses were on diversion through Streatham and I was somewhat dis oriented and surprised to see a 315 on the road I ended up on
The driver took time to assure me I was heading the right way , that I could board safely in an unusual location for me and make sure I was dis embarking in the right place
He was most pleasant and professional 
A real credit to your service and company
If my thanks could be passed on to him I would be most grateful 
Thank you

She immediately contacted TFL to try to change to a standard £5 Oyster card but they refused  to change it and will not refund even though they have not even processed or sent the card.  the card has to be approved by her uni before TfL will accept her application and if the uni does not respond she still gets charged £20. Disgraceful way to treat students with limited funds, don’t know of any other place with such a blatant rip off. They’ve simply taken £20 for nothing or at best a useless card

items.review_text:

items.review_text:
There are a lot of things that TfL do right. We have plenty of buses to keep London moving and the overground and tram systems put the London Underground to shame; we truly live in a city that can be proud of its government public services.

With that being said however, the staff generally seem quite apathetic and a lot of them are significantly overpaid, mainly due to the current mayor Sadiq Khan being inept with managing the system. The bus hopper fare is something to admire, though, I’ll give him that.

More investment into our services and less overpaid bosses would be a good start to perfection.

items.title: Complain to TFL.  Coronavirus (COVID-19): Restrictions on bus travel for passengers.
items.review_text:
Complain to TFL.

Coronavirus (COVID-19): Restrictions on bus travel for passengers.

On the 5th of May 2021 at 07:00am this was my first day going back to work due to the Coronavirus restriction isolation.

This was on the route for the 140 buses at the Target round about Northolt where after the first 3 buses i managed to get on a bus and then needed to change to get on the 114 bus   toward Burnt Oak at South Harrow and that was after 2 buses. I got to Burnt Oak at 08.40am just in time to get to work for 08.55am carrying a laptop that felt heavy. At the bus stop at Burnt Oak there was no problem to travel to the hospital because there are several buses that go past the hospital.  Before the pandemic this journey took me 40 minutes up to an hour maximum.

Since i was able to make it to work by 08:55 am for a 09:00am start it was not too bad although i did get stressed because of the length of travel time [Two hours].  

Because i got to work at 08:55 on the 5th of May 2021 i thought the next day on the 6th of May 2021 that it would not be the same as the day before.

So i left home to get the bus stop at the same time. Except it was so much more worse than the day before. It was after 7 buses at 07:55 am that had gone past that i begged the bus driver to let me on by telling him i work for the NHS and that i need to get to work.  The bus driver said to me that the bus he was driving is for School Runs.  The other Buses that had gone past were the same either school runs, or they were full.  

I got off the 140 bus at Lascelles Avenue Harrow to get on the 114 bus to burnt oak and again after two buses went past that i got on the 114 bus.  I normally change the bus at South Harrow or Harrow on the Hill bus stop but again i thought that there maybe be too many people waiting at these stops so it would be better to change at Lascelles Avenue Harrow.

The time it took me to get to work on the 6th was two and half hours. I was very cold, stressed and in tears thinking to myself that is this what is happening to all of us who travel on the bus?  Is this how it is going to be with the Restrictions on bus travel for passengers. On the 6th of May when i got back home i could not sleep due to the cold in my body and the foot cramps.

I do understand that at the present time we are all in the same boat. But we see so many buses going past that are not full.

Please TFL help us as the government restrictions are lifting and more public will be returning to work.  
As the government wants more of the public to use TFL and less cars to be on the road it would help if there were more buses on the road.  Please tell me what would you suggest to help me to be able to travel to work?

Thank you.

Go to tfl site, saved username and password already there, have to go through two sets of pictures to identify bicycles ("we just need to check something" it says".  Then it says "login failed" even though it's the same password as forever.  No problem, we'll change the password.  Go through verification (designed by monkeys, six times identifying bikes and boats each time).  Get to forgotten password site, put in my email...and get the message:
Something went wrong?  No sh!t sherlock, 30 minutes trying to give you money and "something went wrong".
Sorry for the inconvenience.  No need to apologise guys, get off your ass and make your website work.  Then you won't need to beg for public money at every opportunity.
Access denied.  You don't say!
This website is using a security service to protect itself from online attacks.  Or to prevent customers giving you their money it seems, easy to beg for dosh from the taxpayer than deliver a service I guess.

items.title: Unprofessional Service
items.review_text:
I was issued with the PCN which I challenged but was pushed back (canceled) by TFL.

I was then given a 14 days notice period (on 23rd March) for a discounted rate of £65.00 (with my calculations, this should have been due today the 6th of April).

When I was attempting to make the payment today, a full charge of £130.00 was presented. When I contacted TFL, I was told that this was due at 23:59 on the 5th of April and no exceptions were made for this notice to apply the discounted rate.

For me, this is unprofessional, as it was a long weekend (Easter Bank Holiday) and I had no intentions not to pay the penalty charge. Even after explaining the financial challenges, COVID has created, the lady did not care and no other solution was offered but to pay the penalty in full.

items.title: Very Poor Service in The Capital
items.review_text:
Fares consistently going up despite poor and deteriorating service. 

Some of the main issues I've found with services:

- Buses randomly stop in the middle of their route and tell everyone to get out because they need to go to cover a different area with apparently more deserving commuters. You now have to wait for the next bus which is too full to let you on, or walk. No refund obviously. 

- Bus asked to stop for a period of time to regulate the service. Makes sense but you then get passed by 2 buses of the same service. Surely those that left first should arrive first? Leapfrogging makes zero sense. 

- Santander bike docks in commuter areas too often empty or entirely full. I understand this is often due to customer usage but at least pay attention to the distribution of bikes and try to address.

items.title: Unfair policy
items.review_text: Picked the tickets and two minutes later saw that trains were canceled because of snow. I got refund 6£ instead of 16£

items.title: Great online customer service team
items.review_text: Ok, so the service on all forms is transport isn't always up to scratch (delays, cancellations etc), but I recently needed to email Tfl customer services to get help resolving an Oyster card issue.  They answered quickly and, much to my surprise, followed up a week later with a call, to make sure I'd received their email, as I hadn't had the chance to reply / take action yet.  The issue took a couple of emails back and forth to resolve (purely because I'd misunderstood their initial instructions) and I received responses within 24 hours and they were always polite and helpful.  Really impressed with the online customer service team.

items.title: Shitttty fuuuucking service
items.review_text: Shitttty fuuuucking service. Everyday delays or signal failure. and now they want to increase the price again. FUuuuCK YOU TFL

items.title: They took a year to give me a refund…
items.review_text: They took a year to give me a refund for season pass made just before the lockdown and then refused to refund the full amount.

items.title: Mostly good
items.review_text:
I relocated to London (from Ramsgate) in June. I have found as a non motorist TfL to pretty much always be there for me. The prices are very reasonable and whether I need a bus or a tube train the waits generally speaking do not seem to be long and more often than not I can find a seat but I do not mind standing too much.

The only bad points are:

1) As a man of around average height (5'9") I have had a few knocks to the head near the back of the bus when I forget to duck. However, due to my height ducking is not something I have to do that often so more headroom would be good if they ever redesign the buses.  

2) One bus I was on stopped at a bus stop (reasonably enough) and then the bus driver got out without a word and disappeared. Very bizarre. There was no one waiting at the bus stop at this point. I was sitting on the bus alone for 20 minutes not knowing what I should do. In the end more passengers got on the bus and after 5 minutes longer I got off and chose to walk. However that is an isolated case.

items.title: The worst service in the planet is TFL

The worst service in the planet is TFL.

items.review_text: Shameful that can't even give a 0, absolutely disgusting   and money grabbing at best. I couldn't put on here what i think about TFL and their ulez staff. Have no care in the world, shameful and belligerent manners.

items.review_text: TFL is one of the best services in the country. You can talk to any staff at the station and they are happy to help you out or resolve any issues wihout much of a delay. It is reliable and you can depend on them.

items.title: Can't believe I pay £200 a month but can't seem to travel
items.review_text:
Very frustrating weekend with tube closures. I live in Kennington and work in Wembley Park and am required to work on site. 
The weekend of 24/01-25/01 - both Jubilee line and Metropolitan line have been closed. 
Saturday, I had to take the Bakerloo line to Wembley Central which is then a 15-20 minute walk away to work. Bakerloo is so slow, so I ended up getting an Uber so I wasn't ridiculously late to work. 
Today has been the absolute kicker. Both Jubilee and Metropolitan line are closed. The overground is also not running until 12pm and the Bakerloo line was shut!! 
I got to Waterloo at 7am and the man at the station advised that the first Bakerloo train would leave at 7.20am - not very helpful when I start work at 8am and have a 40 minute journey ahead of me + a 15-20 minute walk. 
I ended up tubing as far north on the trusty Northern line and then catching an Uber to work. 
How is it that in one weeked you can have so many lines closed? I thought having Jubilee and Metropolitan shut at the same time was crazy enough but then to have Bakerloo not open until later, it's just ridiculous. 
I pay £200 a month for my travel card but this still isn't apparently enough and I'm having to supplement my travel with Ubers. 
It would be great if the decision makers at TFL could really think about their passengers and the people that do need to make the journey from south to north.

items.title: Skin cutters
items.review_text:
Again, if Trustpilot ever introduces 0 as a valid rating, please change my ratin of 1 to 0.
TFL is a most vicious, skin cutting, cheap and money hungry organisation in the world. By many people oppinion mafia organisations are terrible. It is much worse when their business is legalized in one of the biggest cities in the world. Transport for London are a master class example.

items.title: Poor service

items.title: I mistakenly paid the wrong PCN on a…
items.review_text: I mistakenly paid the wrong PCN on a hire vehicle ( the PCN numbers were similar and I paid the £80 to TFL in July 2020- so they were never out of pocket. After numerous phone calls over a period of 5 months I was told Ivstill had to pay the £240. The staff are automatons with few manners, no listening skills, at one stage I was blatantly lied to after receiving another PCN for the same hire vehicle which had nothing to do with me. Relentlessly inefficient. Complete waste of time attempting to have any rational conversation with staff there. So they spent time and effort refunding the £80 paid for the wrong PCN and issuing me with another penalty notice for £240. Sincerely hope I never have to contact this hapless organisation again.

items.title: the African bus 281 driver going to Tolworth who took over at Fulwell station. (YT59SFF) on 17/1/2021
items.review_text:
This is a very sad complaint about the African bus 281 driver going to Tolworth who took over at Fulwell station. (YT59SFF) on 17/1/2021 at 15:33

The initial driver arrived Fulwell station at 15:34 & the African driver to take over was no where to be found.

Apparently he was running late, all the passengers waited patiently for his arrival, after about 5mins, finally he was sighted walking down the street on the phone, laughing & chatting away unperturbed without any sense of urgency whatsoever.
He got on the bus, no apologies to the passengers or hurry to make up for the wasted time, after another 5mins he would not settle down to commence the journey, when a passenger called out to him maintaining social distancing, he simply looked in the mirror & arrogantly ignored, sitting tight in sheer nonchalant lackadaisical attitude. The passenger walked up to him & explained that he should have been waiting for his colleague to hand over, but he had kept all the passengers waiting.
In all rudeness, he just waved his paper & said he is obviously still trying to sign in for about 10mins.
Then he pressed the button FALSELY, claiming "the driver had been instructed to wait" ....the passenger told him that was clearly untrue because he was apparently running late & wasting all the passengers time without any concerns or remorse.

To prove his dictatorship, he sat tight to infuriate already exasperated passengers even more & he parked every 5mins till a bus 281 scheduled 15mins LATER passed him and still he falsely claimed his bus controller had instructed him to slow down.

These delays subsequently caused an extra 25mins lateness to the passengers trip.
This is an abuse of public service!

This uncouth driver utterly lacks manners, a sense of time urgency, customer service or professionalism & SHOULD NOT BE DRIVING A LONDON BUS
HE SHOULD BE REMOVED WITH IMMEDIATE EFFECT!

TFL should train the drivers to be efficient, accountable & polite to passengers, not driving like they are providing a charity service to the helpless passengers waiting at their mercy. IT IS UNACCEPTABLE!

items.title: Terrible services on London overground
items.review_text: Terrible services on London overground, with trains supposed to be every 30 minutes which is long enough, and still the trains are delayed every single day, really disappointing when we pay for a service but there are constant delays, or no trains for the expected times.

items.title: Sitting on the train to West Croydon…
items.review_text:
Sitting on the train to West Croydon from Clapham junction, and it is filthy, the windows are black with dirt, the seats are stained, but oh yes tfl clean regularly!! I think not.
Disgraceful......

items.title: Unfair Treatment
items.review_text:
I've been a season ticket holder for 10+ years, however no more.  As with many people I worked at home during the first national lock-down, and didn't give my ticket a thought.   I was going to ask for a refund for the time not used. However as lock-down continued I decided the time was right request the refund. 
My calls went unanswered therefore I emailed and was told that I had to claim within 8 weeks of my last journey and provide proof of that journey from their website! Unfortunately their systems are not up to scratch and I was unable to do this, even a letter from my employer was not acceptable. Consequently when I requested my refund, it was calculated from July not April,  TFL UNDER refunded me approx £500.00. Utterly unfair and bad practice.  Who has money to throw away?
We are living in exceptional times, we have to be flexible and helpful, such a shame this doesn't extend to TFL. Unfortunately I do not qualify to vote for the Mayor of London, Mr Khan would not get my vote

items.review_text: Staff was so rude on james street overground station on 4th of June at 12:25pm as I left my bank card at home and was running late for work I asked very politely to the staff could you help me in that rather than giving good customer service the lady was there spoke to me very rudly by saying ITS NOT A FREE SERVICE. Bruv I am a good citizen and paying all my taxes I knew that tfl never been free.The point is that you are in a place where you can give good customer service, I work in a retail shop and always give my customer excellent customer service. Never have such bad experience with tfl.

My experience with these guys, is that there is no quality assurance, no taking responsibility for things they mess up (contradictory road signage) only harassing the people, who they are there for and "enforce penalties". I guess this describes the culture advocated by their leadership and the (in my opinion) extremely poor standards they follow.

items.title: Terrible service, no refunds available for genuine mistakes
items.review_text:
Paid an accidental 2nd daily congestion charge as insurance due to initially paying through a third party with no guarantee payments would be made. Not protected against these companies to begin with i.e. TfL not first result when searching for website to pay. Not protected against duplicate payments for the SAME vehicle on the SAME day using the SAME payment details.

Wanted to find out which charges had been paid, initially told twice the payments didn’t exist (just as well I didn’t attempt to make a third payment) until they magically appeared on their system. This took over a week to determine over three e-mails.

Scope for a refund is non-existent even with receipts and confirmed payments unless its for repeated payments. What a terrible approach to service. Would avoid if possible but literally isn’t.

items.title: No refund due to changed, but unannounced new policy
items.review_text:
Shortly before the second lockdown purchased my monthly seasonal ticket. 

Read on the Tfl website it is possible to get a refund within 8 weeks after the purchase. 

Due to workload while working from home and not even once using my monthly ticket after the lockdown was announced, in about 3 weeks, after the beginning of lockdown, I finally got time to call and ask for a refund, but what do you know. TfL has changed their policy in regards to the refunds shortly before the second lockdown and no backdated refunds are considered anymore.

I just want to say how convenient, don't you think so?

While other companies have managed to update the information regarding governments latest rules, asap. Not even more than a month after the actual lockdown, Tfl is even slightly suggesting the new policy on the website, so guess it mustn't be only me who got quite an unpleasant surprise once you called and tried to apply for a refund for your seasonal ticket due to Covid-19 restrictions.

items.title: DOES EVERY JOURNEY MATTER?
items.review_text: Every journey matters according to TFL and Sadiq Khan, yet this is a blatant lie. Millions of pounds have been wasted on  pointless projects, barely used cycle lanes and overpaid workers (518 on 100k plus) so TFL are now bankrupt, meaning the motorist is now targeted with the new congestion charge in 2021 to bring in revenue. Bus services are worse than ever as TFL street space scheme has created congestion meaning buses no longer run to schedule and often terminate early, with motor vehicles in congested queues all over London. Hammersmith bridge is still not repaired causing chaos in that part of London due to TFL not having the cash to fix it. Tubes run well as does the DLR most of the time. So if you cycle get the rattler or DLR your journey matters, if you travel by bus lorry van car or motorcycle then TFL don’t give a .... should be the advert.

items.title: cruel, dreadful, poor service
items.review_text:
For the first time in my life I lost my student travel card mid journey on the underground. It was £100 monthly travel card. This caused a lot of distress and I had a panic attack and immediately had to return home from my journey.

 I then phoned TFL and none of the operators showed me an ounce of empathy. None whatsoever. They simply told me to pay full price in the mean time. I was then told my only option to replace the card was to pay a £10 admin fee, in addition to paying full price whilst I sit and wait for the replacement card.

I very reluctantly did this because I had no choice. The website told me 5-7 working days from payment that the new card would be with me. Then the operator told me 10 working days. I asked why the discrepancy and was aggressively shouted at 'This is YOUR fault!! It is not TFLs fault!!'

I was extremely upset by this, as I had not said that it was anyones 'fault'. and to be harassed, shouted at, and blamed when in distress was the last thing I needed when I was already feeling ill.

Since paying for the replacement card, TFL have sent me no acknowledgement of payment, nothing. So I have absolutely no evidence of this should it get lost in the post. There was also no option to choose a tracked service. 

This worries me greatly as royal mail have lost several books due to come to my address. 

This is really terrible service and I have spent the whole day in tears feeling ill. I hope no one ever has to go through this dreadful experience.

items.title: scamming

I got no response from the email and was left on hold over 20 minutes, which cost more. I only went two stops on the train ahd tapped in and out . Really don’t know what their excuse is

What...This man looked as if he had mental issues as he then waved his hand 2 inches away from my face saying don't speak to my staff.and go away.. . despite telling him I would report him he continued and telling him he had no jurisdiction outside the station and I was not using their service.  I was traumatised shocked and disgusted having lived in this area for over 20 years..

items.title: TFL services have gone downhill fast…
items.review_text: TFL services have gone downhill fast since the school kids have gone back! My bus to work was once every 10 mins which was bad enough until they added the school bus services in as every other service. I have been refused entry to the bus a few times, despite the fact that the bus is empty and the "guidelines" are just that! I cannot find anything on website to say it's a rule that only school kids can use the service ( and no one enforces the mask wearing regulation!!) It's really hit and miss what time the non school bus turns up and whether the driver is sensible or not! As I should be at work 15 minutes before I get there I am going to try to claim delay compensation, see if that gets their attention!

items.title: Another dissapointing experience with TfL customer service
items.review_text:
Another dissapointing experience like the many other already on this page.
It's a shame that TfL does not care about their customers and especially annual oyster card holders.
Telling my whole story of discussing and fighting for my money, which took months would take up too much time. But pointing out the most crucial issue: 
After getting my card deactivated without my consent (even though exactly this was required) and not getting offered a replacement card, forced me to pay for my rides myself. These interim fares then were only compensated at a 30% rate. Just sad!

items.title: I take the TFL rain home from work…
items.review_text: I take the TFL rain home from work evreyday. Today I left my macbook pro on the rail and only realised when I reached home. items.title: I’m a student and due to the bridge…
items.review_text: I’m a student and due to the bridge being closed this 533 bus is the only way i can travel home. The ratio of buses to people is ridiculous. I counted the amount of people waiting for the bus one evening it was over 60... and it’s supposed to be 14 people per bus, ( which is always ignored anyway.) due to covid 19. I was on the bus for 2 and a half hours last Friday and i also have lots of work being a student and having GSCE’s... the bus system is honestly terrible. Customers and members of the public are very unhappy and outraged by the service. A lady, a  fellow passenger was telling me how she turned to twitter to complain about the 533 bus and she said there’s been a collective outrage on facebook about TFL. I have to wait ATLEAST half an hour every day after school and it’s always dark when i get home... TFL also said there would be buses made specifically for students however i haven’t seen one yet! TFL PLEASE CHANGE! GET MORE 533 BUSES!!

items.title: TFL - picking on the children
items.review_text: TFL: Ticket inspectors. If your child forgets their zipcard once in 2 years. They will obstruct/prevent your 13 year old them from getting on the tram with all their schoolfriends to get to their school - which is a journey that is free with the zipcard. Your child (who cannot buy a ticket - as you need a bank card, no cash) - will be left soaking in the rain, late for school. They will bully and try and intimidate the parent when they arrive at the stop to pick up their child, and ask them why they cannot show some adult discretion, give them a warning or a penalty fare, just let them get to school - that is the purpose of public transport. Disgusting Low Life - in the midst of a pandemic!. Children are vulnerable people - read your guidelines and apply them in practice. Children are not safe on TFL services, and the inspectors are revenue opportunists....you make us sick! Hopefully the falling revenues mean less inspectors preying on our children.....

No you can’t make a complaint either because their “complaints department” doesn’t take complaints!
