items.title: North Korean Propaganda Service (TFL)
items.review_text: So the bus capticity stated on the bus was 11. There were about 20-25 on the bus. 1st announcement, - "all passengers must be seated. Face masks must be worn at all times and must maintain social distancing at all times". So on your short journey of about 10 stops after this being broadcast about 15 times and sometimes 3 times before setting off people were becoming infuriated. For gods sake the people getting on the bus hadn't even had chance to sit down before the repeated propaganda messages were blaring out! Not to mention given all the window seats were taken you wanted people to sit down (right next to each other) instead of standing up - no wonder people refused - why blurt out the incessant propagdana but double overfill the bus? Please please NPS, stop this. Have you ever thought by using these incessant North Korean Propaganda style announcements that you are adding to the nation's ever increasing anxiety problems and the nation's mental health crisis!? Have any of you policy makers in TFL ever sat throughout a whole journey and endured it? I thought not.... I know TFL nearly went bankrupt, and with this for my own sanity I will now be avoiding buses were possible and using TFL so TFL are only perpetuating their own funding crisis and at the same time driving users and the population of London insane! I wouldn't expect any other reply than we are trying our best in difficult circumstances or that people need to be informed.. simples bus drivers implement face masks at passenger point of entry and don't overfill bus..

items.title: #1 Winner for WORST customer service
items.review_text:
An incompetent disgrace. 
They will gladly sell you a seven day ticket knowing they won’t be running trains. The website is constantly wrong, staff have a strange entitled attitude that they’re never in the wrong, never owe their customers an apology. 
Refund policy is a time wasting trap. 

How these morons get tax payer money is beyond me. My normal 44 minute journey has averaged 1 hour 20 mins every weekend for 3 months. How can you sell a “seven day” ticket when you don’t run trains on the weekend?! How is London operating with a non-existent rail service on weekends?!?!?! 

Frankly, things have reached the point where, besides the commute to work, leaving the house has become unthinkable if you rely on using TfL. So many nice day plans have been ruined that it barely feels worth making the plans to begin with. 

Shame on you TfL, you money grabbing, swanky London office-having, fiends! 

Do yourselves a favour - order a bike!

items.title: Filthy tube trains during Covid and machines not taking cash
items.review_text:
Use the Bakerloo Line and piccadilly line almost everyday and despite a pandemic the trains are filthy and they look like nobody cleans them properly. Some stations close early because of Covid and I wanted to get off at Regent's Park, rather than tell customers at Baker Street before closing the doors and setting off, the driver played the automated message saying Regents Park is closed and the train went through without stopping, how about tell people before you shut the doors so they can get off at Baker Street and walk, getting off at Oxford Circus was much further.

And accept cash at the ticket machines, there is no evidence cash is a major cause of covid. Its just a nuisance and wastes peoples time as we have to look for a shop that does oyster.

All national rail ticket machines take cash. Govia treat customers way better than TFL ever could.

items.title: BEWARE: TFL will not refund your payments
items.review_text:
BEWARE. TFL Will not refund your mistake on the wrong vehicle details entered.
I mistakenly paid for the congestion zone charge on a vehicle I did not use on the date. I contacted tfl helpline to refund this error and even to try and change it to the correct vehicle or at least credit the amount for a future trip. I was abruptly informed that no refunds will ever happen and there is nothing that can be done so I would have to pay for the correct vehicle or face a PCN charge. Of course I know this was a my own fought for not entering the correct vehicle but I cannot understand why TFL do not have a sophisticated computer  system that alerts the customer that the vehicle registration hasn't used the congestion zone and therefore alerting you not to pay and to input the correct vehicle or any other errors on their website.  Conciendently, They do have a system that alerts you that your credit card has been inputted incorrectly and that you should put the right details in.  Effectively TFL have taken my money and possibly many others and still think this is an acceptable behaviour. I cannot describe my anger and frustration in their company and will not use their service where ever possible for future trips.

items.title: Went to London last year exhibit some…
items.review_text:
Went to London last year exhibit some of my sculptures I had to drive them into central London. I hardly had any money just enough to get there, exhibit and back. I had not even enough money to pay my congestion charge up front. However I was there 3 days and rather busy as I was back and forth on the bus to the exhibition. I forgot all about the charge until the day after I arrived paying it on the bus on my phone just before midnight. Phew I thought I had just done it.
 No ... a few weeks later I had a bill for none payment of congestion and ULEZ even though I had paid them they had gone through after midnight.
 So I contested it and was told then a straight no ... and now it was £160 each !! If I couldn't pay it before how could I pay this now ??
I again sent it off to tribunal to look at it ... as I had paid it and just before midnight ; however the email back from TFL shows the payment time as 0:54... 
This has only just come back from an independent tribunal ( from February) saying I still have to pay the fine !!! I have now been in lockdown for 3 months ... no work ... single mother on UC ?? Now I have to pay £160 again ... no heart ... ????

items.title: London Overground Not the Most Respectful Outfit
items.review_text:
This is chiefly aimed at the London Overground particularly Richmond/Clapham Junction to Stratford line.  The only things good about this operator is that it is now cheaper to travel on certain journeys thanks to the integration with the tube network, and the service seems to be more frequent now off-peak when trains manage to run that is.  Other than that it has not much going for it.  The trains have the same smelly carriages, just a bit longer now, the chief reason being that the company will not open the windows to let any air in.  The doors were badly designed so that when the carriages are chock-a-block everyone’s feet catches on the bottom and jam the doors.  My local station had an expensive upgrade following the announcement that the London Stadium would become home to West Ham United.  The result was a cold and uninviting carbuncle owing to the poor design by the appointed architect, who obviously seen the guinea pigs coming.  You also have to go the long way round to get into the station now with no partnership forged with the local authority over disabled access.  That was left down to me to instigate.  Despite several long-term line upgrades over the last few years there are still disruptions to the service on a regular basis.  Another inconvenience is the withdrawal of paper timetables; have you ever tried looking at a whole table on your phone?  Almost impossible.

COVID19 UPDATE: It seems the windows are still locked over what was said to be health and safety concerns.  I would imagine this allows the virus to linger in the air for longer.

items.title: Incapable of issuing season ticket refunds
items.review_text: Terrible refund policy for season tickets. Was first told that refunds could be applied for online and that payment would go back to the original payment card. 20 days later I received an email to say that instead the money would be transferred to Web Credits and could be transferred to future Oyster cards. The email also mentioned that the Web Credits section has a feature to transfer the refund to a bank account. However 4 days later the Web Credit still registers zero balance despite the email indicating that it should have been processed within a few hours. Multiple calls to customer service totally useless.

items.title: Dishonest refund!
items.review_text:
I have requested a refund due to Coronavirus. The request was made on 20th March. I knew that the unfair refund policy of not being pro-rata and in any case I calculated the amount I was due using the monthly/weekly/daily travelcards.

A month later and many calls to  tfl they processed my refund in shockingly an amount less than expected! It looks they didn't bother checking when was the last trip, but instead charged me up to the day they processed the refund.

I better start using a bicycle than spent my money in such a dishonest company!

items.title: Unfair refunds
items.review_text:
On the one hand, we should be grateful to TfL workers who continue to run the transport network.
On the other hand, the refund system for annual tickets is a disgrace. I have used 4 months of my annual travel card and reasonably expected 66% to be refunded. I got back only 56%, so TfL pocketed 140 pounds as a 'fee'.
Their phone lines work ok but operators are useless while my email complaint has not been answered for 10 days and counting.

items.title: TFL IS AN ABSOLUTE JOKE!!!!
items.review_text:
I would say I’m shocked by how much worse TFL are getting but that would be a lie. Most trains are delayed and today (Saturday) my journey has more than doubled in journey time and cost because of rail replacements.

The staff at Lewisham sent me to 3 bus stops they “thought’ was the replacement yet this turned out to be incorrect. After the 4th time going back to the station to advise they sent me to the wrong one yet again they just laughed and said they don’t know. After a search online I found the only way home was the normal bus and then a 30min walk to get home, in;rss I wanted to take 2 buses.

30mins wasted walking around and after 2hours of travelling, this laugh was NOT WELCOMED! Your staff are a joke (some of them) but your company is atrocious. If we, as commuters, could strike (refuse to pay for our journey) the transport system would shut down. Yet the staff are stricking every few months because of the service they are given.... what about us? We pay for travel yet aren’t provided even close to an acceptable service.

What do we have to do to get you to improve it, any of it. You’ve changed the bus 53 route to no longer go to central so I have to now take 2 buses home if I work late at knight instead of the usual one bus (53). I have to give an extra 30mins-1hour each way because of these crappy changes and yet I’m still paying more for each extra journey I have to make. An extra bus or trains costs money, it’s not like I could just refuse to pay it. If only this was possible.


Why don’t TFL pick up I the extra cost? Because they literally do not give a crap about their service, their customers, their staff... only their POCKETS! I hope they lose the contract and go into liquidation real soon. Someone else needs to take over ASAP!!

items.title: Unfit for Purpose
items.review_text:
Probably the worst transport network in Europe. With signal failure, worker strikes, faults, staff shortages, and incompetence being a regular daily feature of TFL service, not only are you extremely likely to experience severe delays on a regular basis, but there is a good chance you won't get where you are trying to go at all.

Add to the abysmally poor service the fact that it is also extremely expensive (low skilled tube drivers are paid as much as airline pilots, which drives up the prices for consumers), and you've got a winning combination for the most hated company in London. 

It is now faster, by far, to cycle to almost every single place in London then it is to use their ridiculous public transport.

items.title: When the underground doesn't work
items.review_text:
When the underground doesn't work, it is hell.
And during commuter hours, it can sometimes be impossible to get on a train.

But overall, the tube network in London is fantastic, and great value for money (especially for over 65's who do not pay), and with wifi coming to all lines underground, TFL deserve praise.

items.title: TFL's solution  to overcrowding on trains
items.review_text: I used to think TFL were okay when they first took over the Metro Shenfield to Liverpool Street line.  Then came the plan for Crossrail.  I thought that was okay too, a new line from Essex into London, wonderful - it will take a few people off our trains and they won't be so crowded.  Then I realised it wasn't a new line, they were just joining up our old line with a new tube line under London.  As if our trains are not crowded enough, now we'll have even more people on them!  And with only enough seats on the new trains for the lucky few, most of us end up standing, crushed like sardines.  I shudder to think what would happen if there was an accident with all those people standing.  Then there's the barging and pushing on the platforms as people try desperately to get one of the few remaining seats, it won't be long before someone is pushed under a train.  But wait! TFL have the answer for overcrowding!  Just shut off the ticket barriers and stop people going down to the platform - problem solved! That's real progress for commuting in London in the 21st century isn't it? A service most of us have already paid for and they're stopping us accessing it.  Thanks TFL for really messing up what was once a fairly good train line.

items.title: A short poem about TfL
items.review_text:
A short poem about TfL, inspired by Rudyard Kipling‘s “If”

If you can not respond when all about you
Are reading things, responding to them too
If you address the customers that doubt you
While stifling laughs that say “the joke’s on you.”
If you can make a heap of all your profits
And grin with pride to watch the coffers swell
Yours is the throne, and none can push you off it.
For you’re in the employ of TFL.

items.title: I WANTED TO GIVE THEM ZERO STAR.
items.review_text:
I WANTED TO GIVE THEM ZERO STAR.. THEY ARE JUST THERE TO MAKE MONEY

Hundreds of families are being affected by TFL's.
there are currently unexplainable delays to license new drivers after passing all TFL's requirements.
Drivers are charged more than £ 300, according to TFL, the total cost for an application for a PCO. Once the requirements are met (DBS check, License check, topographical test, English test)  
Drivers must wait indefinitely (days, weeks, months) without time frame, or service standards for a PCO license. TFL's operatives are delays due to lack of budget and short staff. But each driver is charged hundreds of pounds to finance these processes.
New PCO drivers are told that they are prioritize over new applications, and they will have to wait longer as they receive priority, there is no reasonable explanation of this process. amount of money.
Processes for TFL have been changed by TFL. Test centers were reduced massively to only 6 in London.
Appointments to take the test, then increase the massively in time, the topographical test is left for the final stages of the application. Drivers have then 2 opportunities to pass the test. If test is ultimately failed (less than 60% pass mark) drivers will have to pay full fee again.
Results of these tests remained unexplained. As when drivers received test results there is no break downs of the test.
This also brings unquestionable reasons to believe. And if the TFL should only be charged at the beginning of the test, the cost of the application will be reduced.
It is believing that TFL is using these delaying tactics for private hire drivers, to discourage new applicants to pursue a new license. Reduce private hire drivers and give an advantage to black cab drivers.
Currently, if an applicant meets the statutory eligibility criteria, TFL is legally obliged to issue a license.
The Mayor has called on the government to provide further legislative powers for TFL, to cap the total number of PHVs in London. The government recognizes that PHV drivers are willing to provide for their families. So, the government has been reluctant to pursue legislation and the number of PHVs, so TFL now uses an approach of lack of service, lack of transparency, lack of standards to delay the issue of these licenses.
WE ASK YOU TO SIGN THIS PETITION AS FATHER'S NEEDING TO PROVIDE TO YOUR FAMILIES, FATHER'S THAT HAVE PAID AND COMPLIED WITH REQUIREMENTS SO THAT THEY CAN WORK AND PROVIDE FOR THE LAST AND DAUGHTERS.
- TFL must meet the requirements of a service.
 
- TFL must have a standard of service on all applications.
timeliness 
accuracy 
appropriateness
 
TFL must compensate for new and existing drivers.

items.title: I can hardly believe how awful they are
items.review_text: Where do I start? A terrible, incompetent  organisation that have threatened, misled and bullied me over a fine that *I have already paid*. I have health conditions and their threats to send bailiffs round, seize my car as payment etc is only making these conditions worse. Why on earth hasn't anyone investigated and come down on this organisation yet? This is not the stuff of a well developed, supposedly civilised society, this is the stuff of corrupt juntas and the like. Still can't believe what they are doing to me for a fine that I have already paid.

items.title: Can anyone HELP me please????!
items.review_text: Can anyone HELP me as TFL are chasing me for payment and threatening bailiffs if I don’t pay ultra admission zone and congestion charge on the same road at same time WHEN MY CAR WAS STOLEN!!!!! Police have written to them with a letter, crime reference number and evidence that car was stolen at the time the incident happen, yet their solicitors said they will still proceed with bailiffs until TFL say otherwise. I’m a single mum and told them I don’t have the money and car was stolen but they don’t care. Citizen advice bureau even advised me that on their website it states that you can appeal penalty charge if vehicle was stolen. Been 8 months now still not resolved and fine over £350 now where I keep appealing it.

items.title: I live in Kingsbury and work in…
items.review_text:
I live in Kingsbury and work in Knightsbridge. I was due to start work at 8am on Boxing day. I figured there would be a Sunday service so I  left home a bit earlier just in case. Got to Wembley Park at 7am to find to my astonishment that the station was closed.What. The first train on the Met line was 0725 and the Jubilee 3 mins later. it seems TFL does not believe anyone should be starting work this early. When i get to work 15 mins late i found that half the workforce had suffered that same appalling experience
 and had also arrived late for work. Considering the outrageous prices we pay to travel I believe commuters deserve more.

items.title: I have a Freedom Pass and accidentally…
items.review_text:
I have a Freedom Pass and accidentally touched in using a credit card. I contacted Freedom Pass who said it was a TFL issue as they would have taken the money.

I went online and there was no way to claim for this that I could see. I called the number on the web site and was lead down a rabbit hole of selections, which lead nowhere except a message and was then cut off. I did this about four or five times. 

After an hour of this I got through and was put through to 'Contactless'. This lead me back down a series of rabbit holes, which lead to messages and me being cut off. 

I still don't have my refund and It feels as though the system is deliberately designed to stop people claiming.

items.title: Revolting!
items.review_text:
Revolting!

I never thought that such a bad service is still possible nowadays. 
I had registered oyster card which monthly travels card zone 1 - 4. I lost the card. 

1. Called TFL to block the card. Was advised that they can see the transaction of £194 but the order wasn't fulfilled so I would get the refund automatically within couple of days. 

2. Refund never arrived so I called again. Was advised to wait longer. I gave all the details possible of my account. addresses, when transactions what made, which card, at which station etc. 

3. Than no refund. Called again. Was advised to wait longer as at that point my case was escalated. 

4. A couple of days later I receive an email saying that my oyster card is not registered. What an appalling service. Simply lying. I already spoke to many people and my oyster was registered. When it comes to getting a refund they say that it shows as not registered on their system. Absolutely crazy. 

5. Basically, stole my money by telling my wait for a long time as if I didn't wait it seems that I would have been able to call the bank and make an indemnity claim. 

DON'T USE OYSTER TRAVEL CARD. (Use contactless or pay as you go but never purchase like I did £194 pounds as I have never got my money back - I EVEN provided my bank statement, they can see that I paid and that oyster is not in use as I blocked it but they refuse to give me my money back).

items.title: Awful on all counts.
items.review_text:
Awful web site, awful app, awful customer service.  Service is broken and doesn't register contactless a good 20% of the time, web site doesn't always work with error messages all over the place.  Phone service is non-existent as it only offers fixing via web site and if that doesn't work it dumps you off the phone.

Was 10 years ago the way forward, now dated, creaking and the definition of what bad looks like.

items.review_text: My girlfriend had to get the new Elizabeth Line from Reading to Maidenhead as all the usual trains had been cancelled. Once on it, after having been reassured that the train would stop at Maidenhead, they announced that the first stop was actually going to be Taplow. This caused her major inconvenience. How do you justify the price you charge? 130 quid a month to commute from Reading to Maidenhead, which takes 15 minutes. Shameful.

items.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
items.review_text:
I called the customer service team for obtaining a refund regarding my last travel on `Tuesday when I brought my oyster card (with a monthly travelcard on it) on the back of my iPhone. By mistake, when I passed my phone at the turnstile, I have been charged with my contactless card registered on my apple pay. I called the customer service, not one or two times but, four times for getting a refund of £2.90! The most ridiculous fact is that I've been passed through different teams. A typical conversation was like: "Alright, I'm gonna send you to the contactless payment/Oyster 18+ card team". I've been waiting for ages for someone and, for concluding at best, the system drop me the line. I'm worried about that because It has happened to me but involves thousands of people every day and that is not fair, especially when you are paying for a service that is not worth it. 
Daniele Bauducco

I wonder whether TFL give people their money back if they haven’t entered the zone but have already paid. 

It builds no confidence in the powers that be.

items.title: Dear TFL, thank you Baker Street Staff
items.review_text:
Dear TFL,
Thank you to the AMAZING TEAM at Baker Street Station, namely, Ryan, Shakira, Kassim and Dideir.  I arrived at the station last week, however on my way to the escalator, I felt sick and dizzy.  I then managed to walk over to the staff at the turnstiles.  Immediately, they asked if I was ok and led me to a seat to compose myself.  Throughout my recovery, members of staff sat, comforted and spoke to me, to make sure I was ok.  After a while a felt better and Ryan made me laugh about something which made me forget about the stomach pain, completely.
I got up 10 mins later, feeling much better.
I just want to say how exceptional, kind and thoughtful your Staff are. 
Please extend my thanks to the team, especially Ryan and Shakira.
Kind regards 
Rachel
25/11/2019

items.title: Website and app both useless
items.review_text:
Repeatedly failed to buy a Visitor Oyster card through their website, despite trying two different browsers over a few days.  Even after sending them a screen grab of the error message and the last 4 digits of the card used, they repeatedly failed to find any entry for my attempts in their log file or give me any idea what the problem might be.  I know the details I was giving for the card were correct as I used the same card to buy other things on line both before and after the TFL failure.

Buying a Visitor Oyster card through their website and paying the postage is a scam anyway.  Landed at Gatwick, went to the Gatwick Express ticket office to get the train into central London, and they sold me a Visitor Oyster along with the Gatwick Express tickets without any extra charge.

After installing the TFL app, which was a huge PITA, it informed me that I couldn't register a Visitor card.  No idea why - all I wanted to be able to do was check journey history and amount left on the card.  That information is all available online - the ticket machines at various stations could show me it - but the app wouldn't.

Once I got past this nonsense, the trains themselves were fairly reliable; a 20 minute wait for a Circle line train one morning being the only real problem.

items.title: Santander Cycles
items.review_text: I was charged £86 for renting Santander bike for less than 24h. System works like a scam, there is a lot of pages to read in small letters before you rent. The only clear thing in big letters is initial pay of £2. There is no txt warning or any kind of warning when you start paying outrages money for simply renting z bike for a day. Their helpline just insists it's all in the intro that is few pages long. They know perfectly well that people renting a bike are in a rush or in a group and wont have time to read it. I was a loyal returning client now I hate Santander Bikes and I am dissapointed with TFL to agree to work with them on these terms. £86 to rent a bike for less than a day clearly is a scam!!!

items.title: I cannot thank the staff at TFL enough!
items.review_text:
I cannot thank the staff at TFL enough! 

As someone with mobility issues I was having a very hard day and my legs gave out when I got to Camden town underground station.

I was very distressed and in considerable pain when the staff rushed to my aid and let me recover in their office even though it was a busy Friday night! 
After a while I told them I would be fine to go on my way but they insisted I got a chaperone the whole way back to Waterloo and then continuous checks from the train guard while I was on my forwarding journey.

I have never met such wonderful and caring people and all the staff members who looked after me should be proud of the job they have done.

I thank them all from the bottom of my heart.

items.title: I found a 60+ Oyster card
items.review_text:
Last week I found a 60+ Oyster card (which had the full name of the owner on it). I immediately phoned TFL, who said they couldn't discuss it with me because of "Data Protection" - as I was not the owner of the card (!!!) - of course I wasn't the owner as I was asking them to get in touch with the owner, the details of whom they would have on file. I then asked to speak to her manager - and I was told that I couldn't because of Data Protection.  I think TFL staff need Data Protection training - as the girl I spoke to obviously didn't have a clue about data protection. I then contacted them on Facebook - no reply received and then on Twitter - who took four days to tell me to drop it in at my nearest Tube or Bus Station - I have neither remotely near me. I also contacted Customer Services by email (and gave them my phone number to pass on the the owner of the card) - who haven't bothered to respond.  The sad thing is they they could have so easily just looked up their record and put the owner of the card in touch with me and then it would all have been resolved.  This all leaves me with the impression that the recruitment criteria for TFL are (1)  Zero Common Sense and (b) must be a cretin.

TFL appear to have no procedures in place for what to do when someone FINDS an Oyster card.  I was trying to do my bit in order to help someone regain his 60+ Oyster Card and to not have to pay for a replacement.  Sadly all I encountered was apathy, no-one within TFL seemed remotely interested.  I suppose they see a lost 60+ Oyster card as a nice little earner and so don't even make the slightest effort to try and contact the owner

items.title: TFL couldn’t care less!
items.review_text:
Had an email reply today from Sadiq Khan’s office re why no replies to my complaint despite 4 follow ups.

Guess what? It comes from TFL to complain to TFL!!!!

Around, around, around & around we go, where we are going? Nobody knows!

Couldn’t care less outfit!

items.title: Have been trying to get through to TfL…
items.review_text:
Have been trying to get through to TfL for refund on journey I did not make last week. Made request for refund on-line which has been pending authorisation for several days. Have tried to contact TfL through their contact number 02032221234 try to speak to a human (chance would be a fine thing!) but system is designed to prevent anyone with a problem getting through beyond a bland scripted recorded message then my calls have been politely cut off after going through the maze of options. 

TfL get your act together and provide a 21st century service which we pay enough for not the poor excuse we have to suffer.

items.title: For something so expensive
items.review_text: For something so expensive, it's the worst public transport ever. Overground wait is so long yet always packed. Highbury and Islington is always disrupted and won't allow passengers as it's always crowded. Trains are always stuck.

items.title: I have complained to tfl 4 times now
items.review_text: I have complained to tfl 4 times now, not a single response. The company under pays their workers despite probably earning millions. I take the 132 route to north greenwich everyday and the bus is CONSISTENTLY late, cancelled midway or just doesn't bother to show up. the bus will cancel at sun in the sands and there is never a reason given however I am now late for my university lectures. £15 a week for that???

items.title: Oldest and most expensive transport…
items.review_text: Oldest and most expensive transport system in the world ! Most tube lines are terrible for air quality: try Bakerloo, Northern, Central lines in summer if you want to die ! The temperature goes easily over 35 degrees ! Trains and station are old and filthy while customer service grumpy ! The only lines with air con are Hammersmith and City/Circle Line/Metropolitan line but unfortunately they run the oldest infrastructure possible: 1865 !!!! It's not unsual to wait 10-15 minutes for a train ! Shocking service in what should be first class service. Try Japan, Korea, Hong Kong, Singapore if you want to see how transports should work ! AMATEURS !

items.title: Appalling customer service for…
items.review_text:
Appalling customer service for contactless cards.  I touched in and out my mistake within 1 minute of each other (the system should have picked this up anyway), sent a refund application through my account, received no reply or refund, sent again = no reply or refund.  Telephone a number given and found it was closed for the weekend (this information was not given on the site).  Now on hold for customer service - so far 20 minutes and no reply.  

TFL is not fit for purpose in many respects (there also seem to be many more severe delays on the tube despite 15 years of line upgrades)

items.title: TFL are fraudulently taking money on…
items.review_text: TFL are fraudulently taking money on contactless bank cards. We only found out when we registered the bank cards and saw the journeys they charged us for. When we submitted refund claims only my friend got the full refund even though we did the same journey same times on the same tubes!!! The reply they gave me was, "refunds will not show up in your bank statements but will appear as a plus"!!!! What are they smoking at TFL?!?!?!?!? It's funny my friend got the full refund showing on their statement but mine wouldn't show up! It must be readily available cocaine available in London that TFL Customer Services must be indulging in to send me such a stupid reply! Fraud must be on a massive scale at TFL and we urge all customers to check their Contactless statements as you most probably have been overcharged which is Fraud as they refuse to refund customers that check their statements!

items.title: Appalling communications
items.review_text:
Appalling communications! Nothing on the site about Sloane Square, South Kensington and Gloucester  Rd stations being closed today!!!!!!
Your staff think that we should work that out from engineering works in East Ham?????? Ridiculous, incompetent!

items.title: Horrible Tube Services
items.review_text:
Tfl is practically rubbing people, especially the ones commuting in London! Prices are way to high for what we get!! The Underground services are the worse compared to any,and, I underline Any Other European country!!
On top of it, there are at least 2 or 3 tube lines unavailable every weekend because of “the work in progress”. But the new week starts and there is no difference! The signal failures Starting Over Again Each Monday!! 
And I don’t even have enough words to describe Hammersmith and City and District Line!!
 This is Unbearable!!!

items.title: This website and also the help centre…
items.review_text: This website and also the help centre is the most useless of any I’ve used. The money sucked in by this organisation needs seriously reviewing. There’s an unhelpful arrogance about all their dealings with customers and on the helpline if the call centre worker finds the task too difficult they just cut the call off so be sure to start by getting their details. items.title: Very BAD!

Unfortunately after many phone calls my representation was not received by them even though I have a reference number. They’re  not interested and now I have to pay £160. I am very disappointed with the customer service they have. They’re all lying to you and trying to put you in the worst situation you ever been. Avoid them if you can!

items.title: CIRLE LINE the WORST LINE!

I pay monthly £160 for zone 1-3 but no one cares. TFL, I am very disappointed especially because you have strikes throughout the year but nothing ever improves. Maybe you should focus on customer service and supporting people on the platform because most of the times your staff is unhelpful and on their phone, sitting down in a corner and avoiding contact with customers.

Of course i clicked confirm, i wanted to pay your stupid fee for the pleasure of sitting in traffic in your streets.

What an absolute load of rubbish, your job is just to be a front for a customer service, but all you'll do is sit there ensuring you rip off more and more money of the people who actually pay you!
I've clicked confirm on sending my clothes to a different address before and that customer service team had the ability to help, which is a lot harder then your job!

She then hung up on us when we were giving feedback and trying to be put through to a manager. 

If you dont like talking to customers then do something else. Rubbish.

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text: In the past week several lines were down letting commuters facing incredible stress and frustation. On top of it the cost is ridiculous. You need a better management.

items.title: Rubbish staff
items.review_text: Having received a Disabled Persons Railcard for my partner I wanted to set it up so the discount applied when we travel into London via overground and tube later this month. Having purchased an oyster card I went into Cockfosters station on the way to a friend as I don't have a tube station nearby and the guy done his bit on the ticket machine (reluctantly I thought). I have today tried to add the details onto my account and cannot do it. The reason? The TFL man I dealt with should have given me a passcode to register it. Having phoned two departments I have got nowhere. I could have logged into my bank account and transferred £50,000 in a matter of minutes and yet these load of dumb bells think a crappy Oyster card is worth much more than that.

items.title: Today 29/09/19
items.review_text: Today 29/09/19. I lost my jacket with my oyster card in the pocket at Walthamstow station, and I managed to retrieve my jacket from the cleaner but only to find my oyster card missing.  I spoke to a lovely gentleman with long blond/light brown hair, informing him what had happened. His name is Simeon. He was so efficient and went beyond to assist me. I'm truly grateful to him. I now have a new oyster card and have my weekly payment transferred. Thank you so much.

items.title: For over 4 years now
items.review_text:
For over 4 years now, every time the Liverpool-Chingford overground has its very often happening "repairments" (wich take way longer than told and sometimes useless) the rail replacement services are very bad and sometimes horrible,some of these drivers not just don't know where they must drive to, they are rude. I hope less and less people choose to pay the most expensive travel in Europe for this unprofessional service, especially late night when lone women, and not only, are in greater danger nowadays. 
SHAME!

items.title: Tfl services are terrible
items.review_text: Tfl services are great. You can get from one side of london to the other side of london for less than a fiver. The only let downs are the  staff. Bus drivers in particular. They dont care about you aslong as they get their pay check. So many delays which they dont even tell you about. The buses and trains are normally dirty. If you break your buscard or if it has a small crack then the bus drivers wont let you on at all. This is very disappointing

items.title: Good luck trying to speak with someone…
items.review_text: Good luck trying to speak with someone on the phone as the automated call system wont put you through, it just tries to divert you to go online

items.title: Natasha at London bridge is rude.
items.review_text:
I was treated disgustingly by some rubbish staff at London bridge. Firstly, the machine took my money without topping my oyster up. There weren't any staff at new cross gate so I got on a train one stop to London bridge and encountered a woman called Natasha. I told her my story and she looked at my oyster journey on the machine it for her to misunderstand. I made the journey TO new cross 2 hours ago. Now I was tryi5to reverse the journey to go home. She called me fake, a liar and said she knew it immediately when she first saw me. Another male member of staff was there and he was just as unhelpful and refused to answer any questions I asked him. He said I was twisting his words and making racist insults at him. After over an hour if trying to plea my case and even members of public tried to talk to her, only for her to laugh in their faces, a supervisor called Nathaniel came out. He said he wasn't going to talk to me unless I calmed down, but I was hysterically angry at this point because of the ordeal I was put through. Then Natasha started to shout at me, and I shouted back at her to not do that, had Nathanial restrain me with his arm across my shoulder and then he called the police
 The police arrived and said it wasn't a police matter. But I still had to them them the situation, give my full details to them and eventually, 3 hours after getting to London bridge, I got home. Disgusting. I emailed TFL to complain. This was on the 13th September. I still haven't heard anything back.  I rang the next day to get my £5 back and the woman gave me an additional £10 because I told her what had happened. I'm still shocked by the situation though, and sad that there isn't a faster way to get this sorted.

items.title: Complete and utter crap especially…
items.review_text:
Complete and utter crap especially district and circle line 

Rude and incompetent staff

items.title: My brother 16+ application nightmare
items.review_text:
I called several times about my Brother's photocard 16+, after they go through security questions, instead of trying to resolve the problem they chat with you and gives you reciprocal questions. I don't really know what on earth they are doing there? and how on the moon they got this position to answer people enquirie? WORST DREADFUL service ever. Now almost 15 days and no single move to solve the problem which was an error in their system.
Once the agent on the phone was yawning while talking to me, and in another episode she was chewing gum. 
If you have a child or a little brother to care about, put yourself in the same situation. And most importantly show some courtesy.

items.title: TfL does try to look after their customers
items.review_text:
Well today is my review day. Just had some great service from TfL online who I'd submitted an incomplete journey refund request to. I had been charged the maximum fare for a journey to Richmond. But I always tap in and out (even when the gates are open) and sometimes, the machines do play up. But Steven looked into my dispute and has arranged for a refund. 5 stars for this.

One thing I would like to see is TfL compensating customers for delayed journeys automatically or by sending alerts or questionnaires about journeys for which there has been major disruption in between 2 given stations. I have had a few majors delays between Clapham Junction and Chiswick to and mainly fro, where trains were just cancelled one after another and I was fully charged but wasted valuable hours waiting at Chiswick or Barnes station. Hence 1 star for this.

Average of 3 stars!!!

items.title: Worst service ever
items.review_text: Worst service ever! Never on time and so very expensive! Make your travel being hard all the time ..

items.review_text:
This company is failure .the bus drivers are so rude and not professional at all .I kept complaining and it's getting worse .
It s really confusing.i have a pushchair and today I asked a 140 bus driver to get from the back door. Just to be shouted at from a rude bus driver  .that there is no need to ask .I just need to get in from back door .really boiling .I was advised before that I need to ask the driver first

items.title: Incredibly terrible customer service
items.review_text: Incredibly terrible customer service, apps not working. Continues inconveniences

items.title: Crooked as they come!
items.review_text: What Can I say. Useless and incompetent. I received a fine in May for  Congestion charge which I paid. Then in September (4 months later) they resent me the fine telling me I need to pay. So in remembering I already paid the fine I went to check my account to verify that no refund had been processed and nope, no refund and yes, my initial payment had gone out. So I wrote to them about it and after about a week I received a response which was basically saying the money was refunded to me and I needed to pay it back. I then went to check my account again and only 3 days before getting their response (a week after I received the letter saying I still need to pay 4 months after I did pay) I see they processed a refund. So basically what seems to have happened is they sent me this 2nd PCN (possibly in error or more possibly on purpose to try scam me) after I replied to them telling them I had paid it and no refund had been issued they realised their error and in an effort to justify their mistake refunded me the money  now telling me i need to pay them back in 14days or the fine will be increased. Is this company the countries biggest organised crime syndicate second to Westminster itself or are they all just a bunch of potato heads who have more eyes than they have brain cells? This is an obvious scam whereby they refund your fines and hope you don't repay it in time so they can charge you increased fees. If I was abroad for more than 2 weeks as I am 2 or 3 times a year when this happened I would have been screwed and would have had to pay their increased amount. Disgusting bunch of scam artists!!!!!!!

items.title: Useless is all i have to say
items.review_text: Useless is all i have to say. Theres always a signal failure and the trains are always packed thank you tfl for making me late to work at least 5-10 times a month and i pay 50 pound a week for what?? High prices for the worst services living the London dream yay.

items.title: the worst service ever made.
items.review_text: This service is genuinely the most pointless thing ever made. I’m sure it was created to bring suffering and an excruciating hell to everyone life, but then that will be pretty smart as they managed to pull that off well. Firstly TfL’s staff are particularly wholesome, they take pride in ripping your money out of you even when you’ve been legally using the service correctly for several years. They each come  smartly dressed in their terribly tamed beards and scruffy dirty outfits as well as the fact that they never learnt how to have a conversation without the help of a megaphone. Next the service they provide is 100% unreliable, I would recommend that you add about 20% extra onto your journey time in order to be prepared for all of the delays you should expect. Each of these services are slow and executed as if the driver is trying to have a laugh at you. In conclusion everyone involved with this terrible service should serve time in prison for being so evil.

items.title: The customer service are…unprofessional
items.review_text: The customer service are unprofessional. I called two times for a refund request following an online enquiry. They ended up my first phone conversation and on the second the lady who was on the phone said my refund request has been solved, but have not received any refund yet. Big dissapointment as many times I paid journeys I have not completed😪👎👎👎👎

items.title: an important company
items.review_text:
an important company, many vehicles, many routes, but above all many lies.
excuses about excuses, constant and unjustified delays, buses that do not pass, especially during the night. one of the most notorious is the 21 or its nightly fee the n21, very heavy delays, especially if you go in a southerly direction, drivers who stop the bus in the middle of the journey and force users to abandon the bus indicated as arrived but in reality never passed, a disaster, simple propaganda for its own sake.

items.title: The experience riding in London buses…
items.review_text: The experience riding in London buses are become an absolute nightmare. I am a regular commuter who takes bus to work every day but the buses 487 and 483 are ridiculously unbelievable as they never are on time. I leave home checking the bus time 60% time  buses are either too early than the time or delayed. Time frequency never correct in 487.

items.title: No comment.
items.review_text: Never trust them

items.title: Ripe off Briton !
items.review_text:
I paid my ULEZ charge or so I thought. Apparently I paid London Charges and not Transport for London. Turns out this is a scam and TFL did not receive the 19.99 that I paid to Paylondoncharges. I get that I have been ripped off and there is nothing that TFL can do however I do feel that as I have proof that I have paid and I provided TFL with the receipt. They should now be asking me to pay the 12.50 charge not pursuing me for £80 which is the fine that you get charged if you blatantly ignore their signs and don't make any attempt to pay.
TFL point out in their Notice of rejection of my appeal that they  have many signes warning us that we are entering into ULEZ. Yes we know this that is why we paid the charge. Maybe the precious signs should also state where to pay the charge !!!

items.title: incorrect prices
items.review_text: I called up to ask why the maths doesn't add up between website prices and the prices when discounts cards are added and the person on the phone had a "i don't know what you expect me to do about it/ i don't really care" attitude, telling me they didn't care about the difference. I understand that it may not be a easy job, but you at least expect to be treated like a human being.

items.title: The most burecratic ineffective fine…
items.review_text:
The most burecratic ineffective fine taking organisation in the western world. They issue a fine where 2 of the evidence pictures do not work. I appeal as the driver of the vehicle at the time and the lease holder for the vehicle. They reply 10 days later saying they cannot deal with me as I am not the registered keeper, but they can write to me with all the details of the vehicle and the fine!! I ask the lease company to fight the fine. They are good about it. I collect all the information I have and check the PCN online again as my appeal was through their website. I then find 2 more pictures that would not show before (Funny That!) I can see they have a point and would like to pay the fine. But they have put it on hold from my appeal (Not the registered Keeper) but they cannot take it off appeal as I am not the registered keeper to let me pay the fine. 

Get your act together just because you are a large organisation does not mean you can just do as you like. Every time I phone they will not even talk to me as I am not the registered keeper just the person that leases the vehicle and drives it. Yet they can write to me!!! What a shambles.

items.title: It is impossible to speak to a human…TFL
items.review_text:
No reply to a refund request after almost three weeks via the TFL app.
It is impossible to speak to a human being via a telephone call to the helpline. After negotiating the tedious automated phone selections was redirected to the website app; phone cuts off and goes dead.
It's impossible to get something sorted easily
Really poor customer service set-up.

items.title: Lousy customer service
items.review_text: Just got back from holiday in London and used contactless card on tube a lot. Gets back and online statement from TfL is a mess - half the transactions missing but charging me over the weekly cap. I get on phone to try to sort out on 0343 222 1234 only to hear recorded "Service unavailable" and got this over 2 days! When I finally got through all the options tell you to go to TfL website and log into your account!! Then it hangs up.  Absolute joke. Come on Sidiq stop hiding - earn your £143,000   - look at all these poor reviews for TfL. Someone needs a kick up the backside.

items.title: Staff rudeness
items.review_text: I find staff rude stand around chatting I think supervisor's need to monitor the behaviour of there workers then they want more pay but don't like job and  if asked simple questions look at you like you have a problem .

items.title: I got PNC from TFL for purchasing ULEZ…
items.review_text:
I got PNC from TFL for purchasing ULEZ from an other 'money collector' company they say 'scam': Paylondoncharges. 

They say they are not related. Is any suggestion for going to appeal and going to the court with this? Can't we do anything with a petition? Make TFL to release to charge people was paying for ULEZ and has their receipt?

I was fined of £130 by TFL, also they are sending me every week PNC for other 'some' other reasons. They earn a Hell of my small non profitable business, I haven't even started yet already broken....and now they are not taking responsibility of the scam like this. It is ridiculous. They SHOULD have collect enough money by now to catch the scam like this or warn better, as Paylondoncharge came up at the first place in Google. In my honest opinion obviously there must be a relationship between these two and when there is not enough people has been found, TFL makes sure the website appears up on Google again in the first place. THIS IS UNBELIEVABLE. Anyone is up for a petition or something to fight or stop them? For me £130 is worth it not to allow and keep TFL to do whatever they want to do. Probably the aim to get people out of London or from the country in this way, but before they do, make sure they make a huge amount of money, this must be a bad joke.

items.title: 60%-70% of my weekly journeys are delayed

Last night what should have been a 20 minute journey took more than 2 HOURS due to a broken down train and a massive lack of communication/ very confusing information. I understand its a big company and a lot to manage, but if the majority of my journeys are delayed (some up to 2 hours..) then why do they charge such extortionate fairs?

items.title: It took me an hour on the phone to have…
items.review_text:

Once on the phone with the correct person and after being put on hold the call dropped from their side (I was on my home phone).
Second attempt tool me around 30 minutes to get connected, but then my issue seemed to be resolved within the first 5 minutes.
The biggest issue is the long waiting queue. The second issue is the reduced option list (filtering) at the begining of the call causing one being transferred around until the right right person picks up. Very impressed (negatively).

items.title: Are you looking forward to a nice trip…
items.review_text:
Are you looking forward to a nice trip to London? are you ready to be rip off... then TFL is the place for you to go as a tourist. I have never met a more rude staff than in Ilford station, as a tourist you have alot of question regarding the oyster card and how it works. if you can´t be bothered to be explain things then you probably need another job... instead of reacting with anger which forced us to buy the cards with a deposit of 5 pund each, which we will receive when our trip was done (at the same station).

Last day comes by and we try to return the cards at ilford station... and we are met with another rude worker which tells us, that we can´t return the cards her, and that we need to seek a machine which can handle this... this machine is located in Gants hill which is far away from ilford and you are forced to take the bus. We don´t want to hassle more with worker and decide to take the trip... 

We get there and the machine is out of order.... so we lost 5 pund plus the remain money on the card (7 pund) each. Even when we asked for direction we were meet with the worst service.

Service: SCORE: -5 This is everything from customer service to their network of transportation. Constant maintenance in rush hour  is a hassle for the customer.

Trains, Busses, Tram: SCORE: 3 can get crowd but that is expected for a capital city with millions of people.

If you want to use public transportation... don´t! find a hotel in the centrum and avoid it or mix it with the hop on and off tour busses.

items.title: anyone else had a text at minight giving them 21 days days to renew their ULEZ disount? WHY MIDNIGHT??
items.review_text:
I received a text at MIDNIGHT to tell me my ULEZ would expire in 21 days time - WHY MIDNIGHT??

So I phoned to ask & they explained that is the time my discount expires, yeah in TWENTY ONE DAYS TIME. So why disturb me at midnight I asked? Because that's when...... you get the picture.

I'd like to talk to someone about this.

Why? they're only going to tell you the same as i have she says

But waking me at midnight to advice me of something that is happening in 21 days time could wait until the morning is something I'd like to discuss with someone in authority.

Email us and we'll answer your question. That isn't what I wanted but clearly these incompetent staff are well briefed in what to say.

I still don't understand why I have to be woken over this!

then I wanted to renew my ULEZ discount; If you wish to renew your discount you will need to sign in to your account at and follow the discount renewal process.

says the web site - try finding that & by the time you've pulled all your hair out in frustration, then do a search and it'll offer you TWO THOUSAND posts to read through looking for the one you've described very clearly in the search box and then phone them and then experience the above attitude. That's after holding for a lifetime.

Their website has got to be one of the worst, shortly followed by HMRC.

Khan, you have a lot of explaining to do!

items.title: Bought a 1 month season ticket
items.review_text:
Bought a 1 month season ticket. Eventually walked out of my new job due to transport being so unreliable.

1. Oyster card - failure to buy a season ticket yet payment was pending on credit card. 30 minutes on phone to TFL revealed it was a known issue with their app.
2. Oyster card - failure to buy pay as you go credit of £10 due to issues with the app.
3. Delays on northern line in the morning due to signalling issue at Kennington.
4. Delays on homeward journey due to signaling problems.
5. Delay the next morning due to signalling problems. Train says it is going to Morden via Bank, platform staff say we think it is going to Kennington via Charing cross. Driver says nothing whatsoever. So I'm clueless to where the train is going and so are fellow passengers.
6. Left job cos of it. Asked for season ticket refund to my bank account. 20 minutes again on the phone. Will take 6 days to respond via email. So you can take my payment within a few hours but refunds take weeks!
7. Asked for a manager to call back. Was told it would be evening of Wednesday 10th. Friday 12th and still no phone call.
8. Ask to speak with a manager and I get nowhere. Offered £25 compensation as a gesture of goodwill and promised a manager call back after call recordings are listened to.

Frustrating that I have to wait for a refund when payment is taken within a day. Overall experience of TFL was awful!

Wasted over just shy of 2 hours on the phone to then over the past week and still nothing is resolved.

items.title: Extremely bad service from queens park…
items.review_text:
Extremely bad service from queens park under ground station towards harrow and weald stone and Watford.
Waiting time at queens park station is an average 15 minutes and most of the time there is delays/ signals issue causing severe problems for commuters.
It seems tfl does not care about this issue as I gave been travelling on this route since 2016 and face such situation quite often, seems this is normal for tfl.

items.title: Phone line customer service
items.review_text: I have been trying to get in touch over the phone for more than 2 weeks. Each time I spent 1h to try to speak with someone instead of the robot. I have trying to get a refund for a wrong touch with the card..and .. .I feel like giving up right now...too much stress.  I sent emails....and they ask me to call to..same number 03432221234 that in average you spend 1h to be able to speak with someone then when you speak.  .nothing sorted.....I am so tired..such a shame they don't have an easy way to get in touch with a human being instead of the robot.... Very frustrating!!

items.title: Gang of crooks and fraudsters!
items.review_text:
How the hell did we, the so-called customer and taxpayers, get ourselves in this position?
A position whereby the people that were suppose to represent us, became our masters.

Why am I moaning, you ask ..... Money, what else?

When you owe money to TFL, no matter how small or insignificant the amount, they'll almost certainly chase you till the ends of the earth.
But God help you when they owe you money.  You get the run-around, until you finally realise it's simply not worth the time, effort or aggravation.

If you ask me, they probably already have statistics - showing just how many times these 'pesky taxpayers' should be rejected, before they'll normally go away. 

Had I lived in some or other 3rd world country or communist state, I'd at least know who and why I'm being treated like dirt – But these TFL cowards hide behind a logo - pretending to represent us, the people .... when in fact they're no better than the Mugabe's of the world.
They lie and cheat their way into positions of power, where they then steal from the rest of us.

...and because we fight small individual battles, they simply steamroller or bully us into submission.
I fully sympathise with the people in Hong Kong.  They probably got to a stage where enough was enough.

Anyway – I think it's far to easy for these people to simply say, “the computer says no.”
We REALLY need a system, whereby these jobsworths are held to account.

Any ideas – anyone?

items.title: I understand poor reviews but...
items.review_text:
I understand poor customer reviews but in all honesty, and compared with other public transports in the world - I think the is doing good. Yes, we pay the most for the transport but we get more than anyone else too. Too bad that we can review each line individually because Central line is simply the worse. 
With what we have, I think the tfl is doing pretty good and I believe they are customer oriented and not profit driven. If anyone check tfl financial statements they would know that tfl is loosing LOADS for not increasing prices in the last few years. Yes, there are things that could change without investments and that would on-site station staff who aren't the kindest or bothersome for the most part. Crowd control isn't the best but I don't see how it can improve. People complain about trains being packed but they don't offer solutions - there is no solution. When you get a packed train and the next one is 1min away also packed - you should know that they can't put an extra train because it's already coming every minute. Keep in mind that there is over 10m people in public transport every day and yes, it will suck. 
Buses on the other side, for most rides I had the worst experience and it makes you wonder who gives the licence to most of those drivers. I don't need them to smile and be polite (as most are not) but I need them to be a good driver. Most bus rides makes me nauseus and I feel that drivers are being inconsiderate of standing passengers.

items.title: disgusting service
items.review_text:
disgusting service, trains are always late, buses seem to fall asleep at bus stops, service is like a headless chicken, will rip you off but then decide to work on there terms, trains and busses never arrive when they are supposed to, they will rip you off in ways you couldn't imagin (I have been overcharged in route I have always been taking) and you will go crazy trying to get refund.

bus drivers and or train drivers will do stupid things e.g. 
bus drivers not stopping for passengers, or skipping stops, or waiting 2-5 mins at every bus stop even if there is no one being picked up, almost like the moran is taking a nap

train drivers are no better, underground can have you waiting 15 mins at times, by time train arrives stations are packed out, over ground trains are never, and I mean never on time, they will say train arriving at 9 am, it will mostly always arrive 5 10 mins late with atleat 25 40 mins late once a week on top of that, over ground will then miss stops and go straight to destinations, without stopping at all other stops along the way, making me kiss my stop and having to wait for another train hoping it comes on time and hoping it stops at the stop I need it to stop at.

to get a refund, you can email, or wait 30 to 40 mins on phone, they will almost always try and put blame on you, they will also mix up information as if they didn't read the notes,  didnt read email or didnt hear phone conversation I had e.g. I called in and emailed about 104 took 1 h to finish a 20 mins journey (making me late for work), they take down my complaint and say I will get response through email, my next response is we are sorry the 156 took too long to complete journey (I have never taken 156 bus hence I never complained about it) these people are the worst ever, I reply, this isn't what I complained about I complained about 104, they get back I am sorry 156 did not stop at requested bus stop. It's like excuse me, what are you talking about? (no rwfund for that by the way, still working on it, been over a month)

trains, bus and customer service the whole package is pile of feces, especially for the price, THE MOST EXPENSIVE PUBLIC TRANSPORT SERVICE IN THE WORLD!!!! and we the customer get nothing out of it, not even a decent service, SHAME on you TFL, you disgust me with your practises

items.title: Money making machine
items.review_text: Money making machine. Paying stupid amount of money every day to get one of the worst services. Often trains are cancelled or delayed for “shortage of crew” or “awaiting a member of the crew” however the crew is never short when it comes to what they call “revenue inspection”. If this fails because the reader didn’t work or you didn’t know where to touch if changing from a tram to a train in a station you’ve never been - because that is an alternative route due to their crap service - they wouldn’t even email you to let you know that your card had failed the inspection and you have been charged a certain amount of money (which adds up to the balance, why not). You just pay unknowingly because nobody tells you and who knows how may people pay extra every day without knowing. Absolutely ridiculous.

And the man that eventually came out and told that we’d have to wait for the next one was very unhelpful in his delivery of the information and offer no explanation or apology (this is at uxbridge station and is in regards to the u2). Like I’m aware it’s a long bus route and it’s Boxing Day and expect some changings and difference to how often buses run but if it says they are running every 20 and I haven’t seen one in an hour I’m going to get annoyed. Sort it out

items.review_text: I had problem with my train ticket to Liverpool city (I traveling tomorrow). I came to TFL Wood Lane Station today , Linda advice me go to the Paddington ticket office and they will help me , I went there but they told me that I have to go to the Ealing Broadway ticket office , I went there but they say that I have to find number online and call by myself, I called twice but they doesn’t want to help me , they  want me to buy another new ticket which cost is around £50 , I bought already ticket for £180. I came back to the Wood Lane , I meet Linda , she asked me if I safe my problem , when I told to her that I been in many places and they send me a way and I’m very tired and frustrated, she did the phone call straight a way to the online ticket office , she safe my problem in less then 5 minutes, after she speaking with them and explain the situation as the supervisor they rebooking my ticket without any extra pay. I’m extremely thankful, thank you Linda  for be professional and very kind and helpful only you tried to understand my issue and safe my problem . I wish to have all staff same as you are .

items.title: Congestion charge payment flawed

My question is why they don't send you the charge through the post, let's say 20 quid, and if you don't pay that within 7 days then they send you the £80 present.

items.title: Over priced and poor service
items.review_text: Over priced and poor service. Trains delayed/cancelled frequently and the worst , the trains are over crowded and even no space to breath even at morning 6.30 trains! Zero value for the money paid for this service and not sure Tfl regrets for providing such a pathetic service!!!

items.title: Camden road station
items.review_text: Camden road station: arrogant condescending staff dismiss concerns about the constant delays and interchangeable destinations that appear on screen. After waiting an hour for four trains that got delayed, then cancelled and arrived but didnt stop at the platform, I was forced to walk back out the station and to the underground. The destination also changed from Stratford to Canonbury and then Hackney wick all with in ten minutes. The most frustrating part though was looking at the screen waiting 13 out of 15 minutes for the train to arrive and then it beingq cancelled. This happend four times which is unacceptable to paying customers and calls in to question the competence of TFL rail. Especially since my experience is reiterated in most of the reviews written on this page that are entered pretty regularly. This is at the very least a disgrace and shows a desperate need for change.

items.title: a young black woman gets shooketh by the help of two white men
items.review_text:
Saturday 08/12/2018

I left my purse on the bus after a long day of work and got off at the last bus stop on the 320 bus route, Catford Bridge. When I went into my pocket to get my purse I didn't find it, I checked every pocket in my bag, my jacket, my work apron at least 3 times. I then came to the realisation that I must have fallen out of my pocket when I was sitting on the bus. So I looked around to find the rest stop of the 320 bus and ended up following another 320 bus all the way there. Being a young, black woman, one who happened to be wearing a headwrap because this English weather is really testing my type 4 hair (meaning most people think I'm Muslim so that's another 'reason' for ignorant people to discriminate against me), I had already made my mind up that I wasn't going to get my purse back as I assumed if the bus driver wasn't another minority they would just shoo me away. So you can imagine how scared I was when I saw that the bus driver was a 6ft 4 older white male. However, I never been so shocked in my life. Not only did Stuart, the bus driver, phone up his superiors and make every feasible contact he could, he assured me that everything was going to be ok. He was able to get into contact with the bus driver of the bus I had taken, this other bus driver checked the bus and found my purse! Stuart then let me get on the bus for free and drove me all the way to the bus stop where the other driver was waiting with my purse, he even gave me a free travel voucher just in case my oyster card had be drained (we talked the entire journey about life, the fact that I'm in uni and he said he wouldn't want his daughter to be stranded because she's in uni). When I got to the bus stop where the driver was waiting what I didn't expect was another older, white male waiting outside in the cold for the 30 min journey it took us to get there waiting with my purse! I thanked both guys and wished them all a Merry Christmas. So I promised as a token of my gratitude, that I would write a review for my Christmas Angels, John and Stuart, they challenged my own pre-conceptions of white people, men and bus drivers and made me reconsider my own contempt for a lot of humanity. Everyone always likes to point out the negatives in life but it's times like this, when two kind people went out of their way to help a young, tired woman that make you realise that maybe all the awful stuff happening in the world hasn't completely doomed us. I want people to realise that we need to be kind to each other, because going out of your way to help others is the greatest gift you can give anyone.

BIG UP MY GS STUART AND JOHN, YOU MAN WERE ABSOLUTE LADS <3

items.review_text:
Dear Customer Support

I spoke to Toyin from TFL Private Hire Driver Customer Support at around 4 pm to get assistance in ordering a new PCO badge to wear around my neck as a private hire driver. She was extremely supportive and professional in dealing with my problem. 

She also gave me a realistic timeframe to expect for when the badge will arrive as a demonstration of her resourcefulness. Please give her everything she needs to grow and move up in the company.

She is truly a diamond level asset that TFL cannot, I repeat cannot afford to lose for not giving her what she wants. 

Kind regards

Obinna Patrick

items.title: Very kind staff
items.review_text:
I review relates to a very specific case, rather than the company as a whole but I think it's important to share. I was on a busy Northern line commuter train last week when I fainted. My fellow passengers were lovely and helped me off the tube (thank you Londoners!) but the tfl staff were amazing. One guard helped me to a seat and got me a bottle of water while the other stayed with me. When I was ready to move on, they had colleagues meet me at every step of the journey to make sure I got home ok. 
Tfl and their staff get a lot of grief but on this day, they were amazing!

items.title: Beyond a joke
items.review_text:
Whether it’s their own staff or those dressed as tfl staff running the Overground they are beyond useless on the platform and unable to run most services on time. I say this as a daily user of both the Underground and Overground. 

The staff at Overground stations all stand around talking to each other all day and get angry when you dare ask them a question about the service. I’ve been on a platform and train was cancelled, without an announcement or notice (it just disappeared from the board) Two uniformed members of staff just completely ignored what was going on. Abellio used to run the services from my station and I was hopeful that tfl would improve things. Aside from cleaning the stations and trains a bit, things are actually worse.

As far as the underground is concerned the services are constantly beset with delays, yet are some of the most expensive in the world. I can not understand why in a week, not a single journey in the afternoon can start and end on time.

Absolutely sick of paying money for a service which is terrible and staffed with people that treat their customers with contempt.

Thanks

items.title: I am disgusted and in shock after a…
items.review_text:
I am disgusted and in shock after a phone call i had with an agent who goes by the name of amelia haywood. This agent was rude and in her aproach to my fraustration showed absolutely no empathy during the call and blantantly could not wait to get me off of the phone on friday evening leading to her breaching data protection which to me is very serious. 

I called to pay my congestion charge fine and had to do it before 8pm it was around 7.45pm i had little time left and had already attempted to do it 6/7 times with no joy and was getting a little fraustrated which is understandable. 

I told her of my frautration and
She hung up the phone after trying to tell me how to speak. I was not agressive nor loud. 
            Then to my surprise. When i called back and was on the phone to another agent.  Just as he asked for my details she proceeded to shout out in the background is that ---------!! (shouting out my name in the background) breaching data protection and totally unprofessional. The agent i was talking to agreed that this was out of order. After paying the £80 fine to the automated service i waited on the phone to speak to someone who could launch the complaint, i got through to a chap called Andrew who was clearly sticking up for his colleague and brushing off the fact that she broke data protection, but that was not my concern i wanted to complain.. during my call to andrew i could hear a female voice laughing not once not twice quite a few times and i pointed this out to him, his reply was very unprofessional and it was really fraustrating me even more. No way could the person in the background be having that much fun on the phone to a customer being that it is a fine payment service and not a comedy club! it happened the whole way thought the 30minute call. Half way through the call I told Andrew that i am now forced to record the rest of the call due to bad practice and unprofessional behaviour from his colleague in the background he did not object to this. It was as though she was listening in to the call and laughing at what i was saying which i found very immature. So Instead of rising to it and getting more angry i told Andrew i was recording the call and to get a manager so i could speak to him/her, he replied there is no manager here and said he will get one to call me back within 48hours...   

Never in all my years of calling any company have i experienced what i experienced today on the phone this is wrong on all levels yes it is friday and yes im sure amelia wanted to go home asap but you still have to carry out your duties up until 8pm in a professional manor and show empathy if a customer is a little fraustrated. Clearly she is not customer service material im surprised and shocked.

items.title: Contactless Card
items.review_text:
On our vacation to London this july, we were told that our travels would be easier and at the best rate, if we used our contactless creditcard. We were told that we could use just one card for the whole family. That was not the case. So we were overcharged on our travels. When we got home, I wrote TFL and told them about our situation and they were very helpfull, and today I got the money back I was overcharged. I'm very pleased with the way TFL handled our problem. Thank you!
Best regards Carina.
