items.title: TFL are an absolute joke
items.review_text: TFL are an absolute joke, not only having to constantly deal with rude staff but when something does go wrong being made to feel like your unimportant, 3 separate times ive had MAJOR problems with oyster cards not including the occasional over charging for journeys. The worst one is when I tried to buy a months 1-4 travel card tried it and it failed so tried it again it failed tried new machine it failed called a member of staff they try it failed was allowed through got to the other end staff wanted to fine me for not having a ticket charged me £10 in the end, started to go mental at this point went to guy in ticket office explained what happened and he said what do you expect me to do about it. I lost it wanted to fight him as I checked my account they took 4 lots of travel card money almost £800 has come out of my account and having to deal with the most rude staff ever. It took days to get all my money back and every time I spoke to them on the phone just got me more wound up as they were thinking I was not telling truth. The latest time is tried to top up an oyster by £20 machine timed out and they took money, literally do not bother ringing I rang 5 times got told loads of rubbish. Until i complained on twitter then I got some help but still Its been almost 3 weeks and they have not refunded the money now put a claim in with the bank so hopefully the money will come back. Another time tried to top up it failed twice at least with that time i got my money back on my oyster quickly. Basically the best way to top up your oyster is at a local shop DO NOT DO IT ANY OTHER WAY! as eventually you will get stung.

items.title: Racist ticket inspector from an extortionate bus company
items.review_text: On 8 May 2018 I was traveling from somewhere near Hillingdon in the direction of Ealing on bus route 427. Along the way, a ticket inspector came up the stairs. When he came to check my ticket/pass, he was shown my blue Oyster card. He asked where the accompanying discount card was. I told him that I left it at home.  From there he asked me my name and address which I wrote on a small notebook he gave me. My blue Oyster card was valid with credit lasting to 16 May 2018. After he acquired my name, address and date of birth he started to make all inquiries about my Oyster card to someone he was talking to on a phone. I assumed that he uncovered that I was indeed holding an oyster card whose details matched with the information I gave him. Unfortunately, I was wrong and have received an unfounded Penalty Fare Notice letter from TfL which is intimidating me to pay £40 before 29/05/2018 and £80 after this date. The badge number of the inspector: LB3607.

items.title: Shocking
items.review_text: No one has the faintest idea of what they're doing. We run a transport company with a majority of new vehicles, and despite a 2017 EURO6 PSV (exempt from t-charge) they are still trying to charge us, despite seeing the V5 which states EURO6 and PSV status!? We also have the joy of CONSTANTLY getting congestion charge notices (PSV are exempt) with a photo of a bus attached as evidence, stating we have to pay as it is not a bus... Horrendous amount of paperwork, time & money wasted dealing with such carelessness and unprofessional behaviour. I understand some of this must be automated, but sort it out TFL!!

items.title: Consumer Rights Act 2015
items.review_text:
Consumer Rights Act 2015
On 14/02/18 21:15, waiting for the 274 to Islington, wet and cold night, we are all congregating outside Camden Road overground station.It's heavily raining, council worker are clearing the road for some road repairs, the 274 is pulling over, a bunch of us are waving the bus down(registration LK11CXD I have the pictures ) We are soaked desperate to board the monster when suddenly the driver drove off, we are all speechless, shocked the marquee clearly display bus due and other schedule service and routes 29,253.At this point I decided to chase for a snap shot of the plate and boy did I snap away , I managed to catch up with the driver at the next traffic light and promised him this Usain Bolt snap shot. I have just returned from Scandinavia and I am very disappointed with London, his mayor and TFL, London is legging behind with some of the poorest cities in Europ . Overpriced, overcrowded, poor and bad services .No respect for the commuters, Tubes are in worst conditions, dirty, smelly, overcrowded, gates are rejecting contactless, yet taking a minimum of £5.Overground Stratford to Richmond, delays, beggars, thieves,delays at willisden Junction trains will stop and then get diverted with little or no announcements. CONSUMERS ARE BEING ROBBED, SWITZERLAND, SWEDEN,DANMARK WILL NOT PUT SUCH STRAIN ON PUBLIC FACILITIES. THIS MAYOR HAS PUT EVERYTHING AT RISK, WE ARE ELECTING PEOPLE THAT ARE NOT PUTTING THE VOTERS FIRST BUT AMBITION AND VISION.TFL FROM HERO TO ZERO......

items.title: Great service
items.review_text: Apart from minor delays, trains are often on time. Staff are friendly too.

items.title: vilest service ever met on urban …
items.review_text: Worse service ever met on urban busses accross Europe. Drivers talk through pre made rude annoncements that they send by rows of 5, repetitive orders completely stupid and useless like « please don’t stand on the stairs » just tell me where else can I stand when jammed on a 141 bus route with another hundred or so poor souls, all trying to get to work without having a stroke...?! On top of this, busses are randomly cancelled, diverted, impossible to get a seat into on certain routes at some hours - this reapeating every single day of the year with no improvement brought into the service since 5 years. And yet you are still expected to pay for the journey. Can say these ones are a good business for TFL: a smoky bus from the 20th century jammed with god knows how many people all paying 1,5£ is a great affair for a compagny! It takes on average 45 minutes for this exciting journey to take me 4 miles away from home. Extremely unwelcoming staff with no clue of basic politeness and utterly inert about the issue « uh no I ain’t got a clue how to complain ma’am ». Have also heard stories about some bus drivers sniffing coke before the service which makes them on top of this lack of common sense and politeness unefficient and dangerous. Poor poor service. Wished they’d meet a concurrent service to knock them off once and for good. For now I am on a bicycle as I can’t stand it anymore, being treated like a cattle and still paying for it! Unbelieveable. Start by offering a decent service before you claim the cash you greedy capitalists

items.title: Oxford Circus underground: staff are amazing: supervior Roni and  Asmaıt
items.review_text:
I was a passenger travelling on Oxford Circus on 10/01/2017, I was travelling with very important documents in my hand (pathetic i know) One of them happened to fall on the tracks.

Asmaıt one of the contorollers assited me to the supervisor Roni ( both on duty on the 10 jan and 11 jan 2018).

They gave me extremely bad news and told me that there was no way that they could get it until 01:00 hours when the electrics would be put out!. They advised me to come in the morning of 11/01/2018. I went with no hope.

As i walked in to the supervisors office Roni presented me with the document without a scratch on it to be seen!. To my amazement.

I would like to say a big thank you to both Roni and Asmaıt. It would not have been possible without them.

TFL should be honoured to have staff like this. They deserve a thank you from me aswell as TFL, plus a pay rise.

They are both based at Oxford Circus.

Once again i cant thank them both enough.

Kind regards 
Gunay Ozyurek

items.title: TFL - To Facilitate Lateness
items.review_text: Either this bus arrived at least 8minutes late or the previous bus departed early from the bus stop I boarded at.  I was at the stop at my usual time.  Given the bus was late, two arrived at the same time.  Upon boarding bus there was no alert from driver that other bus be boarded instead as this is a 'SLOW' bus. Driver drove bus slowly, definitely not more than 25miles per hr, if that.  He appeared to wait for traffic lights to turn red before joining lane of traffic, stopping at bus stops without request from aboard the bus [ringing of bell] or the bus stop [no one there].  When he stopped bus at obviously closed [yellow notification with black writing] bus stop, I approached him to clarify reason for his actions.  He then told me he was following instruction to 'even out' the service.  All well and good, TFL but not at the expense of commuter's time.  Especially when commuter allows sufficient time and pays for the service in advance of using it!  It is ever more noticeable that since the introduction of 'pay before you use' Oyster TFL public transport treats the commuter [the financer of the service] as irrelevant.

items.title: Terrible service and poor advertisement
items.review_text: I’m currently a student, I will be studying for the next 2-5 years of my life so I thought it would be in my best interest to purchase an 18+ Oyster photocard. I’ve been using it regularly only to find out 3 months later that I’m being charged the full price when I use it. I contacted tfl about the problem, I was then told that it is my fault and only if I purchase travel tickets I get the 30% discount. This was first of all not made clear at the start when I purchased the Oyster, they were rude, obnoxious and unhelpful over the phone, and I’m wondering why this type of Oyster card even exists if I still have to purchase travel tickets to receive the discount I have paid for!

items.title: Absolutely Amazing Customer Support
items.review_text:
Absolutely Amazing Customer Support. I had lost a property (wallet where I had all my important Cards) in Bus H17 on my way from Harrow. I realised when I changed my jacket that wallet was lost. Quickly I came down and asked help from another H17 Driver, he quickly called central unit and the bus was located. I then had to wait for an hour but got the bus and Driver handed me my Property. Really happy.. No words to express my feelings(Got back My Driving License, Credit, Debit, NHS ID, and Discount Cards)
Thank You TFL Bus Service for taking time to sort my Issue.

He stoped further up in between the stops just to drop passengers but did not want to take us, the people who run after this bus. We run further and did catch up with him at the next stop. Every time I take it I run late to work . For such a big capital the connections are not enough  , for a journey that should take you 35 min , takes over 1 hour and 15 min , this is unacceptable . items.title: No wonder the cabbies call them Totally …
items.review_text:
No wonder the cabbies call them Totally Failing London. They completely messed things up on the Central Line yesterday evening. A passenger incident happened just before 4pm near the east part of the line. By 11pm they were still in a mess. A train that was supposed to go to West Ruislip (the furthest western part of the line) was terminated at Northolt with only notice given one station before. Who runs TFL? Does anyone run it or do they just make it up as they go along?

It's bad enough when they routinely stop trains one stop from the end of the line. Do you run trains for the benefit of passengers or for your own amusement?

items.title: TFL 👎Worst transport company ever known
items.review_text: Worst transport company ever known. Their preference is the hours of work by the drivers and not the continuity of transport services. They cancel buses in the midway and do not replace them. Once a driver is done with his hours but if he is still on route with the bus, the driver just cancels the bus and drops the passengers at the next bus stops and leaves. And the next bus comes after 15-20 mins. This is Awful and unreliable service especially when we are going to work!¡!! Don't know if they will ever improve

items.title: Dire service, Even worse customer service.
items.review_text:
The absolute worst company I have ever had experiences with. 

Last minute line closures all the time.
No replacement service for the closures as it isn't and I quote "cost-effective for them". But it is for them to charge me for a monthly pass I can't use. 
Don't follow there own complaints procedures. Consistently either completely ignored my complaint, or sent generic responses back. Multiple requests for escalation were ignored also. 
Customer service is awful. 
Service is constantly delayed with trains disappearing into thin air - despite the annoucements of a "good service" they bellow over the speakers. 
Staff are rude and couldn't give a damn, overpaid with nothing to do but strike and demand more money. 

Absolutely disgusting, the sheer stress of dealing with these idiots on a daily basis has left me with no choice but to leave London. I hope they get stripped out and replaced with a private company CAPABLE of providing the service.

items.title: If I could give 0 stars
items.review_text: If I could give 0 stars, I would. This company makes money on the back of customers necessity, which is tantamount to taking advantage, as I've yet to see improvements or ANY of the issues I've ever raised with TFL actually being looked into. I've been travelling in and out of London for years and am shocked at how little has changed, and how far behind we are with the travel services in the capital generally. TFL constantly ups the prices, shoddy service remains the same. If I could find an alternate service, I'd take it in a heartbeat! AWFUL SERVICE ALL ROUND!! Best avoided if you possibly can.

items.title: Worst company I have ever encountered

I was shown to the staff toilet where I washed my hands and was even given handcream. What service! My husband and son also cleaned up and off we went to continue our day out in London. Thank you to the staff who couldn't have been more thoughtful.

items.title: Appaling Service

Found myself stranded in central London today when TFL decided to cancel my oyster card as my auto top up credit card had expired, even though there was still £6.80 of credit on the card which would have been enough to get me home. items.title: Poor North West London services
items.review_text:
Poor North London services.

I got to be honest here, sorry. If you live north of Golders Green anything outside the Northern Line is really poorly serviced by buses on that branch (Edgware). If that tube line goes down, you stuck with several broken up bus routes to get anywhere.

Also, I've seen old people and pregnant women left stranded by 204 drivers when they've attempted to signal the buses, and the tube stop bus stops are ALWAYS getting closed down over and over... Why is it that the other branch of the Northern Line has plenty of bus support (even all the way into central London?)

items.title: Cannot collect annual ticket I paid for
items.review_text: I have now tried to purchase a seasonal travel card online several times only to find I am unable to collect it from my chosen station. At first, it was blamed on my own Oyster card getting old so I purchased a new one only to find that this one doesn't work either. Clearly, nobody bothered to check what the actual issue is (clearly the station readers are faulty) and I have not had my refund issued to me for a travel card that I have not received essentially having to pay twice until I can get the refund if anyone even gets around to actually actioning it.

items.title: Thanks Pip!
items.review_text:
A big thank you to Pip, at London Bridge underground station (North Bound) who retrieved my sons toy car from the train track last week. Always friendly with a nothing is too much attitude. Your kindness is never overlooked! 

Thanks again! :)

items.title: Docked bike
items.review_text:
Docked bike, flashed red, but bike locked in stand.
Can't call them as out of hours (out of hours number is only for emergencies)

Sent them an email with details.

No reply to email by 10am the following day, so I decide to call them.

Bike had been successfully detected as docked despite red flash (and they could tell this is what happened) so reasonably resolved.

Phone person didn't like me asking for his name when he asked for mine, but this was perhaps a bit passive aggressive. It's just a bit rude demanding someone's name straight away... imagine if this happened at a train station in person.

items.title: A big thank you to Chas Bamrah at Bond …
items.review_text: A big thank you to Chas Bamrah at Bond Street tube this morning - I just missed a train and there was a 4-minute wait until the next one.  Chas kept us all entertained on the PA system, making jokes and asking hilarious questions.  A really good start to the day!!  It beat just looking at the platform adverts!

items.title: Extremely bad management
items.review_text:
1. OVERGROUND AND UNDERGROUND 
Whatever upgrade works are carried out, under no circumstances should they be disturbing services over entirely weekend. Replacement busses are pointless in weekends, multiplying the commuting time up to five times.

2. WALTHAMSTOW STREETS
Traffic in Walthamstow has been made impossible by some absolutely insane head management, acting based on some fantasias pc programes, not on reality. All streets on right hand side of Hoe Street, going down towards Bell Corner, have been closed, causing incredible amout of anger and frustration among traffic participants. The main 2 reasons made this possible: 
A. Mainly people from immigration backgrounds live in that area, nobody gives a rotten egg.
B. If above is the case, why shouldn't they do that, to create some residential areas therefore increasing the price of properties around. 

All these based on our expenses!!
Is all about £££, you get it?

items.title: London Bridge 530pm 23 Nov. Alarm sounds. Staff panic. Rude and aggressive demands to leave station. Turnstiles opened. No ability to check out. No ability to refund.
items.review_text:
"You used a credit card mate. I can't refund you on that.  It's not my fault but yours for not using a travel card."  " but now I will suffer a default charge for not booking out". "Listen mate what would you prefer to burn to death or pay a fee quid more". 

No fire. No burn. No death. The only spark was the very small ignition driving the very limited intelligence of the TFL operative. If there is a serious emergency then my current belief is that TFL staff will create more of a danger with their presence.  Thank God for Uber. 

TfL. You rarely miss a chance to be rude. Unhelpful.

items.title: A Bus Crashed into my car
items.review_text: A Bus tried to drive me out of my lane in busy traffic. I had nowhere else to go as there was oncoming traffic in the other lane. Despite this, the bus continued to pull out into my lane. I had to stop my car to prevent a collision but the driver continued to pull out, scraping along the side of my car. I signalled repeatedly with my horn but I believe the driver only stopped because the traffic lights had turned red. My partner got out of the car & told the driver he had crashed into the side of my car. The driver responded in a confrontational manner & then drove off. I contacted the police & informed them of what had taken place. I later contacted TFL & informed them of the incident. This happened in May/June 2016 & I have heard nothing back. Thankfully no one was hurt in the incident. The scary thing is, I normally have my 1 year old & 2 year old in the car with me, & my car has signs that state that I have Children on board. I am just grateful that they were not in the car on this occasion. I have a complaints reference number. I also have a reference number for my police report as well as photos of the damage to my car. I also have photos of the bus pressed up against my car.

items.title: poor service as usual( Good for nothing)
items.review_text:

If there is any problem or refund give us a number to call then wait for half an hour. Owao....what a service. I believe if I compare with other Europe commuters then definitely Londoners are paying more but service is very poor.
